title: Freelance Audio Operator
description:
OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY
Fox News Media
FOX News Media operates the FOX News Channel (FNC), FOX Business Network (FBN), FOX News Digital, FOX News Audio, FOX News Books, the direct-to-consumer digital streaming services FOX Nation and FOX News International and the newly announced platform FOX Weather. Currently the number one network in all of cable, FNC has also been the most watched television news channel for 20 consecutive years, while FBN currently ranks among the top business channels on cable. Owned by FOX Corporation, FOX News Media reaches 200 million people each month.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Fox News Media is seeking a skilled Freelance Audio Operator to join our NY Bureau. The Freelance Audio Operator will provide technical operational support for our studio and control room teams. You must have experience operating an audio console for both live and recorded programming.
A SNAPSHOT OF YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES* Operate audio board for live newscasts and productions
* Maintain studio audio equipment
* Manage audio for live and taped broadcasts, including mic sources and IFBs
* Work with technical staff to satisfy production needs for live and pre-recorded programming
* Perform facility checks with A2 and stage manager for all mic and IFB positions in the studio before daily production begins, including studio setup
* Other duties as assigned


WHAT YOU WILL NEED* A Bachelor’s degree in television production is preferred, or equivalent experience
* 3+ years of experience in a TV studio environment
* Proficient in building and executing of effects and shows on the Calrec Sigma, Artemis, Lawo, and SSL System T consoles
* Strong knowledge of audio patch bays, Hydra BSP, signal flow, Enco playout system, and the ability to troubleshoot during live productions
* Must be able to work in a control room for at least 2 hours without a break
* Excellent communication skills required
* Must be a team player who works well with others in a fast-paced dynamic studio environment
* Ability to work under pressure
* Must be available to work flexible, non-traditional hours including weekends and holidays


#LI-KC1*We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.**At FOX, we foster a culture and environment where everyone feels welcome and can thrive. We are deeply committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, including attracting, retaining, and promoting diverse talent across our company. We live in a diverse world, with different ideas and different perspectives that come together to spark new ideas and make great things happen. That means reflecting the diversity of the world around us is critical to our company’s success. We ensure that our viewers, communities and employees feel heard, represented, and celebrated both on screen and off.*  


Pursuant to state and local pay disclosure requirements, the pay range for this role, with final offer amount dependent on education, skills, experience, and location is: $37.50-56.25 per hour. We provide Freelancers medical/dental/vision insurance and 401k after they meet eligibility criteria and any State required time-off, in accordance with applicable plan documents. Benefits for Union represented employees will be in accordance with the applicable collective bargaining agreement.

title: Server/Bartender
description:
Job Overview:  
We are seeking an experienced and skilled Bartender to join our team at [Restaurant Name]. As a Bartender, you will play a vital role in providing exceptional customer service and ensuring that our guests have a memorable dining experience. The ideal candidate will possess a passion for hospitality, a flair for mixology, and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:

- Prepare and serve a variety of beverages to our guests, including cocktails, beer, and wine.  
- Maintain a clean and organized bar area, adhering to food safety standards and ensuring that all equipment is functioning properly.  
- Manage the cash register efficiently and accurately, handling cash and credit transactions.

- Utilize Aloha POS to manage orders and provide accurate billing.  
- Perform basic math calculations to handle cash transactions and maintain inventory levels.  
- Maintain a thorough understanding of our menu and ingredients, including allergens and dietary restrictions.

Qualifications:

- Proven experience in bartending or a related role.  
- Excellent customer service skills, with the ability to handle a wide range of customer types.  
- Knowledge of food safety regulations and practices.  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.  
- Strong knowledge of retail math and the ability to manage cash transactions accurately.  
- Familiarity with Aloha POS and experience with cash register operations.  
- Experience in a restaurant or hospitality environment is preferred.  
- A friendly and welcoming demeanor is essential for this role.

title: Teacher Assistant
description:
Overview

We are seeking a dedicated and nurturing Teaching Assistant to join our team. This role plays a vital part in supporting the educational and personal development of children. The ideal candidate will have a passion for working with children and a strong understanding of their needs and behaviors. Our goal is to provide a safe, inclusive, and supportive environment for all children to learn and grow. As a Teaching Assistant, you will be a valuable member of our team and will contribute to the development of our young students.

Duties

As a Teaching Assistant, you will be responsible for assisting the lead teacher in the classroom and providing individualized support to students. Your duties will include:

- Assisting the lead teacher in preparing lessons and activities  
- Providing one-on-one support to students with special needs  
- Helping with classroom management and behavior management  
- Providing childcare and infant care services  
- Assisting with first aid and emergency situations  
- Engaging in nannying and caregiving activities  
- Promoting childhood development and educating children  
- Maintaining a safe and clean environment for all students  
- Developing and implementing strategies to support students with diverse learning needs

Requirements

To be successful in this role, you will need to have:

- Experience working with children and their diverse needs  
- Knowledge of special education and childhood development  
- Excellent caregiving and behavior management skills  
- First aid certification or willingness to obtain  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment  
- Strong communication skills  
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team  
- A passion for educating and supporting children

If you have a genuine interest in working with children and are committed to their growth and development, we encourage you to apply for this rewarding role.

title: Laboratory Technician, Sanger, M-F 9am-530pm
description:
**Position Title:** Laboratory Technician I

**Location:** South Plainfield, NJ

**Shift:** M-F 9am-530pm

**Intro**


At Azenta, new ideas, new technologies and new ways of thinking are driving our future. Our customer-focused culture encourages employees to embrace innovation and challenge the status quo with novel thinking and collaborative work relationships.


Azenta Life Sciences is a global leader in the life sciences space with headquarters in Burlington, MA, and offices and operations worldwide. We are a market leader in automated bio sample management solutions and genomic services across areas such as drug development, clinical and advanced cell therapies for the industry's top pharmaceutical, biotech, academic and healthcare institutions globally. We provide unparalleled capabilities with our lab analysis, sample management and storage services, informatics software, and consumables, with the largest installed base managing over 1 billion samples globally.

**How You’ll Make an Impact**  

 Our Lab Techs strictly adhere to laboratory SOPs to ensure quality and safety while handling samples for Sanger Sequencing. They are proactive, detail oriented, able to meet tight deadlines, and strive in fast-paced work environments. They understand the big picture, while paying attention to the details. They understand our customer needs with empathy and know that everything they do is making a difference. On-site training will be provided.

 **What You’ll Do**

* Adhere to Safety Protocols
* Strictly follow SOPs and site trainer’s direction in training, sample handling, project processing, and documentation
* Assist and maintain the cleanliness of work area
* Sort incoming samples
* Prepare sequencing template, including preparation, amplification, and PCR purification
* Labware Washing, biohazard waste collection and packaging
* Communicate with customers by e-mail in a friendly and professional manner
* Assist in purifying sequencing template and load samples onto sequencing machines
* Ability to lift 25 lbs.
* Job requires both sitting and standing for 8 hours a day
* Must be able to bend, twist and walk for extended periods of time
* Fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination
* May require working overtime and/or weekends on rotation

**What You Will Bring**

* High School Diploma required
* AAS Degree or equivalent lab work experience preferred
* 1+ years of lab work experience preferred
* Excellent attention to detail
* Proactive team member
* Able to work under pressure and meet deadlines
* Eager to learn and retain new concepts quickly
* Excellent interpersonal skills; both verbal and written
* Previous laboratory experience a plus
* Micropipette and multichannel pipette experience a plus
* LIMS experience a plus

title: Bilingual College Prep Advisor/Coordinator SY 2023-24
description:
The International Leadership Charter High School is searching for an exceptional highly motivated College Prep Advisor/Coordinator The International Leadership Charter High School is a high performing college-preparatory high school located in the Riverdale/Kingsbridge section of the Bronx. International Leadership Charter High School is dedicated to delivering a high-quality college prep program for all students. From 2013-2017, our school performed in the top 25% of High Schools nationally. We were the recipient of a Bronze Award from U.S. News & World Report and recognized as one of the Best High Schools nationally from 2013 through 2020. International Leadership Charter High School implements an academically rigorous Regents and college-preparatory curriculum and provides a superior high school education.

Duties/Responsibilities:

* Provide individual and/or group advising to participants in areas relating to career exploration, the post secondary admissions process and financial aid process and application;
* Work closely with the Director of College Prep
* Facilitate College Prep activities for the Junior and Senior class;
* Maintain and update records on all students, as well advising and student progress logs;
* Assist in the preparation and submission of college application materials, such as transcripts, essays, recommendations, etc.
* Initiate and maintain contact with community-based organizations, schools, colleges and other educational institutions
* Assist in the planning and implementation of college and career readiness workshops;
* Plan and provide supervision on college campus visits and other educational trips; • Provide monthly reports and other advising reports as requested;
* Conduct constant follow-up with students to ascertain where they are in the college process;
* Set up appointments and follow-up meetings with students on an on-going basis and prepare 90% of the sophomore and juniors will take the PSAT exam.
* Perform other tasks as assigned by the Director of College Prep and Head of School.

Qualifications: Minimum requirements are: Bachelor's degree, in an area related to counseling, social work, or teaching. Excellent communication and writing skills: Exceptional organizational skills and motivated; Resourceful and works well with others on the team. Familiarity with the college admissions and financial aid application process is a plus. Bilingual proficiency in Spanish/English is value added.

title: Litigation Attorney
description:
**Job Description**

Goldberg, Miller & Rubin is a regional insurance defense law firm with offices in Philadelphia, Manhattan, and North Jersey that has been successfully litigating cases for its clients for close to four decades. We are an aggressive and talented team of trial attorneys who are dedicated to getting the best results for our clients.

We are seeking a civil litigation attorney to join our New Jersey team in our general liability and bodily injury practice areas. This position is hybrid/remote based on experience.

As one of the region’s prominent civil law firms, we are recognized for our successful representation of individuals and companies facing liability relating to automotive and trucking negligence, medical malpractice, toxic torts, work related accidents, as well various other forms general liability. Since the firm’s inception, we have also worked with our clients in combating healthcare and insurance fraud throughout the region and have cemented ourselves as one of the region’s top firms in this arena.

**Responsibilities**

Our attorneys get REAL responsibilities from day one. Talented attorneys get full ownership of a case from inception to resolution meaning they are the point person for the day to day responsibilities and handle all aspects.

* Drafting of pleadings, correspondence, memoranda, and other documents.
* Record and disseminate all information on behalf of the clients.
* Summarize medical records and highlight important information.
* Write reports to clients summarizing the status of the case and the next steps that will be taken.
* Identify, research, and analyze legal issues and conflicting legal opinions.
* Take and defend depositions, handle arbitrations, and argue motions.
* Attend in-person and virtual court appearances.
* Provide legal representation of clients to protect their interests in defense of complex and high exposure litigation.
* Explain litigation to those unfamiliar with the process.
* Take charge of cases to move them toward cost effective, efficient, and fair resolutions.
* Juggle multiple assignments and/or deadlines while maintaining a professional demeanor.

**Requirements**

* Experience in civil litigation: automobile negligence or premises liability is a plus.
* Experience handling depositions, mediations, arbitrations, and other complex assignments.
* Excellent research, writing, and communication skills.
* Exhibits good judgment and organizational skills.
* The ability to manage a large caseload and the day-to-day tasks involved within cases.
* A strong desire to learn and grow in their legal profession.
* Strong verbal and interpersonal skills in order to work effectively with senior attorneys, partners, staff, clients, opposing counsel, and the court system.
* Experience billing for your time.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

title: Director of Nursing (DON)
description:
**Liberty Endoscopy Center (LEC), a GI Ambulatory Surgery Center located in New York, NY has an exciting opportunity for a Director of Nursing to join our team!** 

**This is a chance for YOU to become a part of an organization focused on patient care, preventing colon cancer and raising awareness!**

**What makes us awesome:** 

*Perks and Benefits*

* No evening, on-call or holiday work hours
* Paid Time Off including: Vacation, Sick Time, Holidays, Bereavement, Jury, and Voting
* High quality, Cost effective Medical, Dental, Vison, and Prescription coverages.

**What you do:** 

This position will oversee the daily clinical operations of the Center and work with the related professional offices and PE to ensure quality patient care and to maintain the Center’s premier reputation within the community. This position reports directly to the Administrator. The Director of Nursing will be responsible for the clinical setting and will manage entire clinical operations of the facility, including all of the clinical staff at the facility. This position is responsible for nursing services, daily clinical staffing and the efficient flow of patients through the endoscopic experience. In addition, the Director of Nursing will oversee fiscal management of clinical supplies and staff as well as ensure that all policies are followed. The DON will also be a member of the Continuous Quality Improvement, Risk Management, Infection Control and Safety Committees. The Director of Nursing will be responsible for organizing/managing all manuals and studies necessary for continued certification and accreditation, maintaining appropriate documentation. The DON will function as a working Nursing Manager, taking on the role of admitting nurse, procedural nurse or recovery room nurse, as needed.

**What you will be working on:** 

*Fiscal Responsibility*

* Promotes cost containment and efficient use of center resources.
* Coordinates purchasing of clinical equipment/supplies to provide optimum patient care within budget allowances.
* Analyzes work area and makes recommendations for potential cost-effective improvements.
* Staffs the Center as efficiently as possible when there are known down-times (vacations, etc.)

*Clinical* 

* Determines and schedules appropriate staffing assignments to support the flow of patients through the procedure area. Keeping in mind patient care needs and budgetary constraints, discusses changes in staffing with the Administrator.
* Completes competency worksheets during the employees’ introductory period (To be done within 30 days), keeping the employee aware of their successes and areas that need improvement.
* Acts as the onsite expert in clinical skills, being a resource for other staff members and performing one on one teaching as needed to enhance the learning of new skills.
* Monitors the daily flow of patients making recommendations for efficiency or customer service. Conducts ongoing room utilization studies.
* Acts as the Medical Records Supervisor, who along with the Administrator, has overall supervisory responsibility for the entire medical record system. Acts as onsite expert for the electronic medical record and dictation system, assisting the Physicians and staff in learning the system and troubleshooting problems.
* Plans in-services for the clinical staff that expand their knowledge of GI procedures, and the equipment used during these procedures.
* Assures compliance to all clinical policies and procedures, and bringing to the attention of the Administrator and the Medical Directors any problems with Physician or staff compliance.

*Supervision of Staff*

* Daily supervision of clinical staff and charge nurse.
* Manages the hiring process of all clinical staff. Ensures that all new hire forms, verifications, and screening is completed correctly and submitted to PE in a timely manner.
* Working with the Administrator, conducts and documents disciplinary actions, as necessary, in consultation with PE for all clinical staff.
* Working with the Administrator, conducts clinical employee evaluations annually, and provides input as needed, for all Center staff.
* Recommends salary changes, documents personnel changes and submits completed paperwork in a timely fashion. Responsible for 90 Day Introductory evaluations and the annual performance appraisal of all clinical staff.
* Submits all personnel changes on a timely basis.
* Monitors and approves timesheets and Time & Attendance System for all clinical staff and submits accurate time summary to the Administrator for biweekly payroll by predetermined due date/time.
* Ensures that policies are adhered to concerning the accrual and usage of PTO (Paid Time Off).
* Ensures that all Policies and Procedures are explained to staff and that these policies are followed.
* Working with the Administrator, conducts regular staff meetings and maintains meeting minutes for these meetings.

*Purchasing* 

* Matches all approved packing slips with invoices for drugs and clinical supplies.
* Approves and codes invoices for payment and submits to the Administrator.
* Monitors and tracks all returns to ensure that Company receives the appropriate credit.
* Assists clinical staff with ordering of the clinical supplies. Ensures that order is within budget/contract that was negotiated.
* Formulates cost effective measures in the clinical areas and implements such within fiscal guidelines or submits to the Administrator for review/approval.

*Miscellaneous Duties*

* Closes the Center at the end of the day when necessary.
* Attends meetings for the Governing Body and Executive Committees as needed, and presents clinical items to the Board of Managers.
* When required, initiates a “911” call, and gives information according to policy.
* Performs additional duties as directed by the Administrator or Medical Director (within the scope of training).
* Participates as the clinical team member of the CQI, Infection Control, Risk Management, and Safety Committees. Assigns staff as needed to these committees. Prepares agendas and writes all reports for these committees.
* Directs the ordering and inventorying of all GI supplies, medical supplies and medications.
* Keeps updated on all GI procedures, through reading and/or attendance at local or national meetings.
* Leads team through any cardiac or respiratory emergency.
* Working with the Administrator, monitors the environment of care, including temperature, cleanliness, sterility, operational ability, ventilation, lighting, etc.
* Serves as the nursing team leader during any emergency situation concerning patients.
* Working with the Administrator, responsible for writing up reports on all Emergency Drills.
* Serves as the Centers Quality Management Nurse/Coordinator and on-site Infection Control Nurse.
* Responsible for updating all manuals in the Center necessary for certification and accreditation, inserting any changes/additions into the manual.
* Conducts chart reviews to check for completeness, and enforces the need for consistency in documentation. Reviews chart review worksheets completed by the nursing staff, making corrections/suggestions as needed.
* Acts as the nursing liaison between the Center, the Physicians and Physicians Endoscopy.
* Functions as a working Nursing Manager, taking on the role of admitting nurse, procedural nurse or recovery room nurse as needed.
* Maintains center and equipment to ensure cleanliness, sterility, and operational ability at all times
* Other duties as assigned

**What you know:** 

* A successful applicant must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.
* BSN or equivalent college degree and current state RN license.
* Prior experience in a Management role, including supervisory experience, infection prevention and quality control services.
* ACLS/BLS certified, with current experience in GI diagnostic procedures. Current membership in SGNA preferred.
* Familiarity with state, Medicare, AAAHC, and Joint Commission accreditation preferred.
* Proficient in computer programs including EXCEL, Outlook, and WORD.
* Strong organizational and analytical skills.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

**Liberty Endoscopy Center (LEC) partners with PE GI Solutions who provides over 600 gastroenterologist partners industry-leading practice and center management solutions across the nation. This includes a comprehensive business approach to compliance, operations, corporate services, and clinical support. For more information about our partner, PE GI Solutions, please visit www.pegisolutions.com.**

**Diversity & Inclusion**

We value diversity! title: Payroll Associate
description:
**Job description**

**Join us as a Payroll Associate!**

The Payroll Associate for our CDPAP Program is responsible of executing and handling daily payroll operations, in conjunction with all the respective sites (Brooklyn, Bronx, Flushing, Jamaica, & others). Performing in the prism of collection and verification of timekeeping information and processing payroll. This covers the field of; managing payroll records and timekeeping based on verification of worked hours; employee benefits; billing for multiple vendor types; and accounts receivables.

**Some of your key responsibilities include:**

* Review and confirm PA (Personal Assistants) time in the system. Check accuracy of employee time-in and time-out based on the approved authorized hours. Follow up with Case Managers and Schedule Coordinators on worked-time issues and make appropriate corrections.

* Reconcile check listing and validate reports post-confirmation.
* Overview of checks, review its accuracy, and confirmation of correct worked hours.
* Manage and support customer service by answering phone calls with inquiries about pay-stub, hours worked, timesheets, and others.

* Administer another related task delegated by the Director of the department.

title: Clinician, Adult Women's Residential Program
description:
**Job Description**

***Clinician, Adult Women’s Residential Program*** 

Under the supervision of the Program Manager, the Clinician is responsible for performing clinical assessments, creating treatment plans, and providing individual and group counseling to women with substance use and co-occurring mental health disorders. Additionally, the Clinician is responsible for family counseling and education. With an active caseload of up to 8 residents, the Clinician will provide trauma-focused therapeutic interventions and co-occurring disorder treatment to pregnant and/or parenting women with children up to the age of five. This will be done in an effort to support and strengthen their capacity to engage in healthy practices and create stability. The Clinician will work closely with the Assistant Program Manager, as well as collaborate with the Early Relational Health (ERH) Clinician. The Clinician will promote the use of the Nurtured Heart Approach© in all activities with the goal of promoting a safe and comfortable environment for all individuals within the CGE community and within all business relationships.

1.) Perform all duties and demonstrate behaviors and attitudes consistent with the Mission Statement and Core Values of the organization, and the Nurtured Heart Approach©.

2.) Continually participate in building and maintaining positive working relationships through effective communication, performance improvement and teamwork efforts.

3.) Be of good character and reputation; sufficient physical, mental, and emotional health to satisfactorily perform her or his job duties.

4.) Actively participate in safety programs of the organization by identifying potential risks and promoting client safety as well as environmental safety.

5.) Accomplish individual and team goals and objectives established by supervisor based on prior performance evaluation.

6.) Comply with HIPAA guidelines regarding client rights and confidentiality.

7.) Comply with documentation and training set forth by Human Resources.

8.) Actively participate in CGE's clinical research efforts by ensuring accurate and timely reporting for all assessments and evaluations.

· Participate in intake sessions and collaborate with other residential program staff to ensure accurate and timely completion of all intake documents.

· Maintain records as required by organization policies and regulatory and accrediting agencies.

· Utilize Motivational Interviewing and other techniques to develop a trusting relationship with residents.

· Administer clinical assessments of women in order to lead to diagnostic impression and appropriate level of care and make recommendations for development and management of treatment plan.

· Provide trauma-informed substance use treatment and interventions, individual/group/family counseling, and psychoeducation to address substance use and co-occurring mental health disorders.

· Integrate attachment-based knowledge of parenting into substance abuse interventions to support long-term recovery and maintain an awareness of the impact of parenting challenges on treatment interventions.

· Provide crisis intervention as needed.

· Request and coordinate with medical/psychiatric consultation for further assessment as needed. Provide all necessary treatment updates to nurse/psychiatrist as needed.

· Prepare and deliver oral and written case presentations to the treatment team and appropriate professional agencies as indicated, i.e., DCP&P, Legal: Probation, Parole, Drug Court.

· Maintain records as required by organization policies and regulatory and accrediting agencies.

· Identify, coordinate, and prepare residents for appropriate discharge upon completion of program.

· Participate in weekly residential program meetings for development and revision of integrated treatment plans and coordination of case management activities.

· Participate in program, committee, and clinical staff meetings and clinical training program(s) as indicated.

· Utilize the “Adult Resident Handbook” and “Phases of Treatment” to assist residents with program guidelines.

· Assist with maintenance of referral list.

· Coach Residential Associates to attune to the unique needs of each resident and to collaborate, create, and implement individualized plans to meet these needs

· Assess the counseling needs of the clients.

· Assess clients using the ASI or using other standardized assessment tools and diagnosing clients for substance disorders using the DSM.

· Determine the appropriate level of care based on ASAM PPC.

· Obtain previous records that are relevant to the current treatment episode.

· Collaborate with the client in order to develop a written treatment plan that is client-centered and recovery oriented and includes goals and measurable objectives.

· The director of substance abuse counseling shall develop, monitor, and provide clients and the treatment team with written schedules that will be used to update each client treatment plan(s) in order to ensure that each client's treatment needs are addressed.

· Provide the substance abuse counseling services specified in the client treatment plan.

· Review clients throughout the treatment episode according to ASAM PPC, to determine the need for continued services or discharge/transfer.

· Review and, where necessary, revise the substance abuse counseling portion of the client treatment plan to address emerging problems.

· Develop the client discharge/transfer plans to ensure movement to the appropriate levels of care.

· Contact referral sources, providing case consultation, and coordination with referral sources (for example: mental health treatment providers, criminal justice agencies, schools, employers, the Department of Children and Families).

· Participate as a member of a multidisciplinary team for assigned clients.

· Provide active case consultation.

· Document all counseling and education services, assessments, reassessments, referrals, and follow-up in the client's clinical record, providing appropriate signatures and dating of such entries, including those made in electronic records.

· Continually participate in building and maintaining positive working relationships through effective communication, performance improvement and teamwork efforts.

· Participate in CGE staff meetings and training as requested.

· Work as a member of a team to establish and maintain a high level of care and respect for, and communication with residents.

· Work in a consistently professional manner at all times, which includes, but is not limited to, treating all residents, staff, guests, and volunteers with dignity and respect.

· Uphold on-call responsibilities on a rotating basis.

· Remain flexible and available for day and evening hours, including some weekends.

· Assist with transportation, as needed.

· Provide support to ensure seamless transitions among CGE’s continuum of care as needed.

· Provide clerical assistance in the main office to assist Residential Associates (RA), as needed.

· Perform other duties as requested.

· Master's degree in counseling, education, social work, or related field experience.

· LAC, LSW or comparable licensure required; LPC or LCSW preferred. Willingness to pursue LCADC /CADC credentials within three years of employment.

· Minimum of one (1) year experience in the addiction field.

· Experience working with high risk, substance-using populations in residential settings.

· Experience with cognitive behavioral therapeutic approaches and motivational interviewing preferred.

· Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills with friendly and professional demeanor.

· Passion for CGE’s mission and purpose and an ability to communicate this passion to others.

· Team player approach. Strong organizational, project management and problem-solving skills with impeccable multi-tasking abilities.

· Ability to be flexible to the daily changing needs within the community and to handle obstacles with compassion and resolve.

· Current NJ driver's license needed; will be required to meet safe driving requirements.

· Bilingual (English/Spanish) speaking a plus.

title: Kids Fitness Coach / Administration /PE Teacher /Sales
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discounts
* Health insurance
* Opportunity for advancement
* Paid time off
* Training & development

  

**Coach / Administration /Sales**  

  

*Do what you love, love what you do!*  

  

At KidStrong our mission is clear. We help parents build smarter, stronger, more athletic kiddos, with character. Our team is a fun loving group of elite ‘unicorns’ with experience in a variety of fields including management, child development, physical education, personal training, coaching, athletics and athletic training, pediatric OT, and more. The common thread on this team is the drive and desire in making a positive impact on kids and families, while also developing ourselves and those around us to be better every day. Be excited to foster an environment of camaraderie, friendship, fist-bumps, and positive energy. We take this mission far more seriously than we take ourselves, and if that doesn’t excite you, we are sure there is a lovely cubicle job out there for you.  

  

https://youtu.be/OeNL6jMnsDE  

  

Our New Jersey/NY/CT regions is rapidly growing and we are looking for talented, enthusiastic professionals who want a career in building better kiddos and are excited to be part of a young, fast moving company. New Jersey/NY/CT will have 20+ KidStrong centers in the next few years and we are looking for individuals to help build and guide those to success.  

  

Is this a nine to five, Monday through Friday job? Not a chance. Our Center is open Monday -Sunday.  

  

Join our team at KidStrong's newest location to gain valuable experience in our business operations, nurture your leadership abilities, and pave your path for advancement within our company  

  

  

**What we expect…**  

A motivated individual, whose passion for kids, paired with a growth mindset and the desire to learn and develop as a leader drives them daily in efforts to make a positive impact. Someone with a solid understanding of sales and operational excellence who, in combination with the General Manager, will use our lead generation/marketing strategies plan to increase sales as well as engage in customer relations with members and parents.  

  

A leader with a positive attitude who is ready to utilize a thoughtful approach to all aspects of the organization while taking great satisfaction in meeting and beating goals, with a “Win the Day” philosophy. Someone with experience with kids, who leads from the front, getting on the mat and teaching approximately 15+ classes per week.  

  

**What does an Operations Specialist do?**  

 The Operations Specialist role is vital to the smooth operation and continued success of the center. It's a combination of teaching classes to kiddos, making sales calls to families who reached out to us, as well as some other light admin duties; like manage the inventory from time to time and respond to emails/texts from prospects and members. The great thing about the “Ops” position is the wonderful mix of being on the floor, coaching and working with the kiddos, and then balancing that with some administrative work.  

  

**We are looking for:**
  

* Experience with children and/or fitness industry strongly preferred.
* Associate or Bachelor’s degree in business, education, or related field would be a plus
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong work ethic, integrity, and professional demeanor.
* Practical work experience using Microsoft Office Products


  

**Certifications Required**: (These can be obtained post-hire, and must be kept current)  

* CRP certified
* First Aid certified
* EpiPen certified

  

**Physical Demands:**  

* Our staff is asked to work out with the kids, know the proper form and corrections, and actively run the activities. Bending, kneeling, crouching, crawling, reaching, balancing, etc
* Aerobic activity
* Sustained physical exertion
* High energy
* Ability to lift 50 pounds

  

**Wrapping it up:**  

* Full time Position, with benefits..
* Paid time off
* Health insurance and dental insurance option
* Paid sick leave
* Continuing ed in leadership development

  

**If you think you’re ready to join the KidStrong team and make a positive impact in the lives of hundreds of kids, then apply NOW and let’s talk! We offer interactive training and a FUN, busy work environment that will help you get all your daily steps in!**  

*This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to KidStrong Corporate.*

title: Extrusion Technician 2nd Shift
description:
**Company Description**  

Cornerstone Building Brands is the largest manufacturer of exterior building products in North America. Our comprehensive portfolio spans the breadth of the residential and commercial markets, while our expansive footprint enables us to serve customers and communities across North America. Our relentless focus on excellence combined with our ongoing commitment to innovation and R&D has driven us to become the #1 manufacturer of windows, vinyl siding, insulated metal panels, metal roofing and wall systems, and metal accessories. We believe every building we create, and every part of that building, positively contributes to communities where people live, work and play.

 **Job Description** **JOB DETAILS**

**Base pay** **$23-$26 per hour,**

**2nd Shift: 3:00 pm - 11:30 pm**

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


Provide extrusion troubleshooting services to production as needed to resolve problems, including process modifications, tooling alterations to maintain a process capable of meeting customer requirements. In addition to troubleshooting, tool maintenance and minor flow adjustments will be performed as necessary, along with process improvements to maintain a competitive productivity level.

* Able to assess a situation and determine if an issue is machine related or process related and take corrective action
* Efficiently work on non-conforming processes to get them in specification
* Diagnose complex extrusion problems to resolve issues, inclusive of flow corrections
* Work with the supervisor, lead, engineering, and maintenance to resolve complex issues
* Assist with production qualification runs including capability assessment
* Participate in and support projects that are driven by business initiatives
* Provide training, instruction, and guidance to production associates
* Support, train, and assess associate learned skills through the Pay for Skills program
* Work in a safe manner and follow safety policies. Ensure co-workers are working safely and following safety policies
* Train new operators
* Analyze SPC data to determine process/product conformance and trends
* Analyze production data and make necessary adjustments to operation of machines within the work cell
* Identify and communicate appropriately when electrical/mechanical/technical support is needed
* Participate and sustain 5S activities
* Participate in and lead kaizen events and sustain improvements from those events
* Maintain and develop back-up tooling and transition tooling into production
* Help transition and qualify new materials, processes, and profile applications
* Identify and implement process improvement concepts
* Help to identify and assist with experiments aimed at reducing customer related concerns, improving process capability and tooling longevity
* Help develop and train associates
* Conduct and provide feedback where applicable for associates
* Participate and support projects that are driven by business initiatives
* Set-up and start-up any profile for all machines in a work cell
* Tend to and operate machines in a work cell to produce required parts as determined by customer requirements and the production schedule
* Perform maintenance tasks as necessary
* Attend and participate in appropriate training and development programs
* Perform other duties across the plant as needed as directed by supervision or management
* Assists crew lead and supervisor with the training and development of entry level and senior level operators

  

**Qualifications**  

* Experience with profile extrusion.
* Strong prioritization and multi-tasking capability.
* Strong aptitude in problem solving and process improvement.
* Strong computer skills – Windows, MS Access, MS Excel
* Equipment maintenance experience
* Ability to articulate problems and solutions verbally.
* Ability to read and comprehend written instructions and process procedures.
* Ability and skills to collaborate effectively in a team environment.
* Self-motivated and capable of managing stressful situations.
* Be able to lift 50 pounds.

  

**Additional Information**  

Site Location: 1 Silverline Dr. North Brunswick Township, NJ 08902

**Why work for Cornerstone Building Brands?**


Our teams are at the heart of our purpose to positively contribute to the communities where we **live, work and play**. Full-time\\* team members receive\\*\\* medical, dental and vision benefits starting day 1. Other benefits include PTO, paid holidays, FSA, life insurance, LTD, STD, 401k, EAP, discount programs, tuition reimbursement, training, and professional development. You can also join one of our Employee Resource Groups which help support our commitment to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment.


\\*Full-time is defined as regularly working 30+ hours per week. \\*\\*Union programs may vary depending on the collective bargaining agreement.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Residential Associate - Full-Time/ Part-Time
description:
**Residential Associate** 

Grounded in a spirituality that treasures the dignity of all, The Center for Great Expectations seeks to create a safe place, safe presence, and a safe path, that enables clients to experience, choose and maintain physical, psychological, social and spiritual health for themselves, their children and families. Our continuum of care offers trauma-informed, behavioral health services to our clients in residential, community and outpatient settings.

CGE is currently seeking compassionate and dedicated individuals to join our team as Residential Associates in our Adult and Adolescent Residential “Mommy and Me” Programs to work with mothers and their children.

In this vital role, you will have the opportunity to make a profound impact on the lives of mothers and their children. We are currently offering a range of positions, including full-time, part-time, and per diem roles, with flexible scheduling options. Typical shifts include mornings (7 am-3 pm), afternoons (3 pm-11 pm), and nights (11 pm-7 am).

As a Residential Associate, you will receive training in trauma-informed care, preparing you to provide high-quality support to adolescent and adult mothers and their children within a supportive behavioral health environment. Some key responsibilities include but are not limited to:

* Assisting with Activities of Daily Living and Parenting Activities: Helping mothers with routine tasks and parenting duties to ensure a stable and nurturing environment for their children.
* Medication Administration: Ensuring that medications are administered correctly and on schedule.
* Engaging in Recreational Activities: Participating in activities that promote physical and emotional well-being.
* Providing Transportation: Assisting with transportation needs to ensure mothers and children can attend appointments and access essential community services.
* Offering Emotional Support and Conflict Resolution: Providing support and verbal de-escalation while remaining emotionally regulated.
* Managing Admissions and Discharges: Facilitating the smooth transition of mothers and children into and out of the program.

To be considered for this role, candidates must be at least 21 years old and possess a valid driver’s license. This position is ideal for individuals who are passionate about direct care or those pursuing degrees in social work, psychology, sociology, counseling, education, and related fields.

Joining our team means becoming part of a community dedicated to making a difference. If you are interested in this rewarding opportunity, please visit our website at www.cge-nj.org to learn more and apply. If your preferred schedule is not listed, you can use the “General Application” to specify your availability.

title: Associate Research Scientist - CMOS/Brain Organoid Project
description:
Interested Applicants can apply via Interfolio at this link - http://apply.interfolio.com/152723

**Job Summary**  
The Bioelectronics Systems Lab (http://www.bioee.ee.columbia.edu) at The Fu Foundation School of Engineering & Applied Science of Columbia University in the City of New York invites applications for an Associate Research Scientist.

The Associate Research Scientist will conduct research in the Bioelectronics Systems Lab designing and building components for a hybrid CMOS-Organoid computing device. Reporting to the Lab Director, the Associate Research Scientist will be responsible for studying circuit mechanisms that generate and pattern developmental waves, identifying ways of validating the devices, and working with graduate students and postdocs.

The Associate Research Scientist should be able to work independently, troubleshoot, and resolve problems involving both equipment and processes in Columbia’s cleanroom facilities. The Associate Research Scientist should be able to learn about unfamiliar topics quickly and independently. The Associate Research Scientist should be able to communicate clearly with lab users, other team members, other departments of the university, and vendors as needed.

The Associate Research Scientist will also assist with general lab management responsibilities for maintaining a safe and effective working environment within the Bioelectronics Systems Lab in compliance with all University and government requirements and regulations as directed by the university's Environmental, Health, and Safety (EH&S) department. That includes but is not limited to the safe handling of chemicals and gas cylinders, implementing and maintaining safety training, and safe manner of work in the laboratory.

**Qualifications**  
A Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering, Neuroscience, or a related field is required. A minimum of 5 years of working experience conducting organized research or other related educational experience is required.

**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**

Columbia University is an Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran

**Pay Transparency Disclosure**

The salary of the finalist selected for this role will be set based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to departmental budgets, qualifications, experience, education, licenses, specialty, and training. The above hiring range represents the University’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $78,155.00 - $85,000.00 per year

title: Dentist II
description:
Welcome to Zufall Health!
  
  

Position Summary
  
  

Under the general direction of the SVP of Dental Services, provides direct dental care to patientsat the health center. The dentist is a member of the health center’s clinical team with thepurpose of providing evidenced-based and quality dental care to Zufall Health Center(ZHC) patients.
  
  

Essential Functions, Duties, and Responsibilities
  
  

* Provides primary dental care for patients of the Zufall Health Center, including but not limited to diagnostic and therapeutic assessments, treatment of conditions and illnesses within the scope of practice, referral and follow-up of patients, and other duties as assigned
* Assists patients in obtaining community resources, referrals, and other services as clinically indicated by the center’s diverse populations
* Assists patients in accessing services with the local provider community, including physicians, hospitals, and laboratories
* Participates in clinical performance improvement activities and conducts peer reviews of colleague’s charts as assigned
* Assists in the training and orientation of dental assistants, dental residents, and other students. Attends regular meetings of the medical staff and other meetings as deemed necessary by the Chief Medical Officer or SVP of Dental Services
* Assists in the development of written objectives and policies for the provision of dental services
* Participates in clinic operations by ensuring compliance according to local, state, and federal rules and regulations, and ensures that licensing, credentialing, and educational activities are kept current and up to date
* Contributes to and follows established policies and protocols for clinical care
* Demonstrates compliance with ZHC’s policies, procedures and quality improvement practices
* Participates in community health initiatives including health fairs and other educational activities as directed
* Maintains membership in professional and organizational associations as appropriate
* Performs other duties as assigned


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
  
  

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Able to relate well to a diverse group of patients and staff
* Able and willing to work on an as needed basis in order to meet operational needs of the clinic
* Proficient with computers, knowledge of Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel and use of electronic medical records
* Learn and apply the trauma informed care principles with the scope of the position


Education, Training, and Experience
  
  

* Current license to practice dentistry in New Jersey
* Possession of a valid DEA and CDS registration
* BLS Certification
* Minimum 2 years clinical dental practice in an ambulatory care setting
* Knowledge of federal programs and community health centers is a plus
* Bilingual in English and Spanish a plus
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office, typing, and use of electronic medical records


As a condition of employment, we require that all staff are fully vaccinated against flu. Therefore, if hired during flu season (typically between September-May), all new employees need to be fully vaccinated against flu and are required to provide documentation of receiving flu vaccines upon hire.
  
  

Zufall Health an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability status, medical conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Thank you for taking the time to apply!
company_description: Zufall Health Center is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit FQHC that provides access to high-quality, affordable medical, dental, and behavioral care to people and communities who face barriers to care.

title: Insurance Claims Reconstruction Coordinator
description:
**Why Join the Team?** Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and both commercial and residential properties throughout the U.S. and Canada. Paul Davis Restoration of Metro New York is headquartered in Queens and serves the broader New York City Metropolitan Area. We are growing locally and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We view every Project Manager as a long-term hire. We hire only dedicated “A Players”, with the goal of developing them into experts in the field and future leaders in our company. We provide excellent professional training and a great company culture. The vast majority of our employees have been with us for over 5 years.  

  

**What does a Reconstruction Manager with Paul Davis do?**  

  

Reconstruction Managers work with property owners and insurance adjusters after events such as a fire or flood to clean up and repair damage to residential and commercial properties. As a Reconstruction Manager, you will supervise the renovation including all the subcontractors, as well as manage costs with the insurance provider. This means you will spend a good deal of time in the field.  

  

**Job Responsibilities:**  

  

* Oversee all aspects of assigned construction projects including managing client & insurance adjuster expectations
* Ensure an accurate scope for projects and prepare estimates utilizing estimating software
* Build relationships with insurance professionals and customers (both direct and B2B);
* Ensure high quality work by effectively managing subcontractors and vendors
* Maintain written communication with vendors, customers, insurance representatives and team members

  

  

**Qualifications (Requirements):**  

* Hungry and self-motivated, with a strong sense of ownership and responsibility.
* At least one year in construction industry
* Strong attention to details, time management, problem solving, and project management skills.
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills.
* Ability to management multiple jobs and crews at one time
* Proficiency with current mobile and computing technology, and ability to learn new software
* Efficiently manage and maintain job management software, ensuring it is consistently up to date
* Clean driving record and a reliable car
* Estimating software experience is a plus


  

**Prior experience as a restoration project manager, construction project manager, estimator, or insurance adjuster are strong pluses** (but must be willing to learn a new process). Industry certifications or licenses (such as IICRC, Lead, Mold, etc.) are also strongly preferred. If you have limited experience but you meet all the qualifications, we will invest in your training!  

  

**Compensation and Benefits:**  

  

* Highly competitive compensation structure, with base salary plus uncapped commissions based on projects completed. Our current Construction Manager's yearly total compensations range from $50k (base salary before any commission, paid weekly) to >$200k depending on production. Candidates with significant prior experience as restoration project managers may qualify to start immediately as Senior Construction Manager at a higher base salary. Regardless of seniority, there is no limit to earning potential! We believe in meritocracy and rewarding high performers!
* Significant opportunities for professional growth – 3 to 6 months of structured training to learn the Paul Davis Way, ongoing Leadership Development Program, 1-on-1 mentorship, and access to Paul Davis University and other regular ongoing training opportunities.
* Emotionally rewarding career. Not only are you helping people in time of need, but once fully ramped up, you will be given an extraordinary amount of autonomy and control over your work – fully trusted by the company to function as a "mini-CEO": managing your own budgets and teams, setting your own schedule, honing your style, and developing personal relationships (but with full support and mentorship from the company along the way);
* Eligible for full benefits (an initial qualification period may apply), including: health and disability insurances; earned vacation and sick days; 401(k) with company matching; HSA with company matching; and additional annual performance-based bonuses.
* You will have the autonomy after training to control your schedule and continually seek learning opportunities that will improve your skill set
* Generous monthly cell phone allowances, car allowances, gas and toll reimbursements, etc.

  

  

The physical environment requires the employee to work in all types of both indoor and outdoor conditions. Sometimes required to use personal protective equipment.  

  

Please apply if you think you have what it takes to serve others and deliver a world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.  

  

**We love to support and hire Veterans, and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!**

title: Disaster Recovery Project Manager
SaaS Account Executive: Construction industry
description:
ATS is transforming the construction engineering and design processes. We create tools that solve commercial building product manufacturers' biggest challenge; driving demand for their product at the specification stage. We also are leaders in the use of AI to simplify and expedite the quotation process that allows manufacturers to sell more and distributors and wholesalers to win more projects.

ATS has a strong work ethic committed to delighting clients and providing them with exceptional service. Our thriving and motivated culture is the heartbeat of our organization. We hope you will become a part of it!

**As an Account Executive, you will focus on:**

**Subscription Revenue**

* Generating new relationships and building rapport with manufacturers, wholesalers & manufacturers reps
* Learn the ATS value proposition and be able to dialogue with your prospects about where they are experiencing challenges that ATS can solve.
* Keeping thorough notes and building account plans to ensure the playbooks are followed
* Identifying internal champions and work with them to help escalate the ATS message inside their organization
* Achieve annual quota targets
* Sales strategies - Develop effective and specific account plans to break into new accounts and develop relationships to drive a strategy throughout the organization as a trusted advisor. This is a dedicated focus on securing new logos.
* Develop territory strategy with marketing team to maximizing coverage
* Customer Acumen - Actively understand your client’s technology footprint, strategic growth plans, technology strategy and competitive landscape. Review public information for the company and its competitors to remain updated on key industry trends and issues impacting the prospect.
* Business Value Selling - Utilize customer success studies, benchmarking and ROI data to support the customer’s decision process.

Encourage all accounts to become references.

**Demand Generation, Pipeline And Opportunity Management**

* Pipeline planning - Follow a disciplined approach to maintaining a rolling pipeline. Keep pipeline current and moving up the pipeline curve towards 2,3,4 & 5x coverage.
* Advance and close sales opportunities - through the successful execution of the sales strategy and roadmap.
* Support all promotions and events in the territory
* Hunter mentality with a high-velocity work ethic

**Sales Excellence**

* Sell value using a disciplined approach to understand the customers challenges so you can position the solution in the context of the challenge.
* Maintain a curious approach to self-improvement and input to always be growing in skill and mastery of the art of selling.
* Maintain CRM system with accurate customer and pipeline information.
* Understand the competition and effectively position solutions against them.

This role focuses on prospecting, pitching & closing our company’s software solutions to construction industry professionals including manufacturers and their representatives, wholesalers, and others involved in construction specification creation & project quotation.

**As our Account Executive, you must have:**

* A post-secondary degree in a related field with 5+ years of progressive experience as a quota carrying new business hunter in SaaS based technology sales;
* a minimum of 3 years of construction industry exposure with either product manufacturers, wholesale distributors or independent sales rep experience in the plumbing, HVAC, electrical or similar categories
* A good understanding of pricing, distribution and supply of publicly tendered commercial construction products as it relates to MEP (Mechanical, Electrical and plumbing) including the standards, local building codes and the ability to interpret construction documents and specifications.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to manage and influence across all levels of the organization;
* Superior organizational skills, with the ability or prioritize and manage multiple tasks with accuracy and strong attention to detail;
* Proven analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to quickly learn new concepts/processes;
* Adaptable, flexible and comfortable working in a fast paced and frequently changing business environment;
* Professional demeanor and appearance with a flair for polished presentations;
* Willingness to travel - overnight travel is estimated at 15% to 20%;

**Your Life and Career at ATS:**

ATS is dynamic, industrious, innovative and collaborative. We believe diverse and inclusive organizations create work environments that are inventive and open-minded, where people spark new ideas and explore alternatives. At ATS, we offer the following to make sure you have a rewarding and enjoyable experience.

To learn more about our company visit our web page: https://www.atssoftware.com/ and our promotional video: http://youtu.be/MPyk3BdN-8o

title: Director - ALM & Market Risk Modeling
description:
**Your opportunity**
--------------------

 *At Schwab, you’re empowered to make an impact on your career. Here, innovative thought meets creative problem solving, helping us “challenge the status quo” and transform the finance industry together.*  

The Asset Liability Management (ALM) team within the Corporate Treasury department manages the balance sheet with over $500 billion in interest-bearing assets and approximately $300 billion in fixed income investments and additionally approximately $100 billion off-balance-sheet brokered deposit agreement notional investments. The ALM team is also responsible for balance sheet modeling and analytics, market risk management, and net interest revenue forecasting.
As a key people leader within the ALM team focused on Market Risk Modeling, you will take an integral part in overall interest rate risk management as well as strategic optimization of the balance sheet and corresponding NIM profile through development and execution of a robust market risk modeling framework in collaboration with business partners, including investment portfolio managers, risk partners, and product leaders across the firm.**What you have**
-----------------

 **Required Qualifications*** Ten years relevant experience (or combination of time in post graduate studies) in treasury, finance, and/or ALM roles, including at least five years of professional experience at an institution or institutions of a similar size and complexity as Charles Schwab.
* Five years of experience leading multiple individual contributors
* Degree in a quantitative field such as Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or Economics
* Strong fixed-income investment modeling and analytics knowledge
* Expertise and hands-on experience in balance sheet modeling, net interest revenue modeling, and EVE modeling
* Direct experience modeling derivatives and associated hedge accounting
* Strong knowledge of fixed income modeling in systems such as PolyPaths, QRM, BlackRock, Murex, Intex, Bloomberg, Calypso
* Knowledge of premium discount amortization and associated impact of principal prepayments on NII
* Knowledge of securities accounting standards and implementation
* CFA, FRM or PRM designations required

 **Preferred Qualifications*** Experience with Python and SQL or another general-purpose programming language
* Enthusiasm to work in white space and the ability to create innovative analyses to help drive the strategy and risk management of the balance sheet
* Ability to multi-task while maintaining composure in a potentially fast-paced environment
* Strong written and oral communication skills

**What you'll do:**  

* Manage a team of about five people.
* Lead all aspects of modeling of the balance sheet including the fixed income investment portfolio, mortgages, and other exposures to interest rate risk as well as interest rate derivatives and off-balance sheet exposures.
* Lead development of a robust Market Risk Management modeling framework focused on Economic Value of Equity (EVE) sensitivity, Capital at Risk, Net Interest Income (NII) sensitivity, and other industry standard metrics.
* Lead initiatives to enhance, streamline, and automate balance sheet analytics and dynamic NII sensitivity measurement.
* Partner with Model Risk Oversight in development, validation, and performance monitoring of models used in the Market Risk Management framework.
* Play a key role in achieving risk-return optimization mandate within ALM subject to a strong market risk management framework.
* Work with ALM Strategy, ALM Analytics, and Investments teams via new and existing capabilities, tools, reports, attributions, and optimizations to inform the optimal positioning of the investment portfolio through rate cycles, with a significant emphasis on risk management.
* Collaborate with key business partners to drive balance sheet analytics to support investment allocation decisions, strategy, and risk management.
* Leverage industry investment research and stay abreast of peer and industry trends.


In addition to the salary range, this position is also eligible for bonus or incentive opportunities**What’s in it for you**
------------------------


At Schwab, we’re committed to empowering our employees’ personal and professional success. Our purpose-driven, supportive culture, and focus on your development means you’ll get the tools you need to make a positive difference in the finance industry. Our Hybrid Work and Flexibility approach balances our ongoing commitment to workplace flexibility, serving our clients, and our strong belief in the value of being together in person on a regular basis.


We offer a competitive benefits package that takes care of the whole you – both today and in the future:

* 401(k) with company match and Employee stock purchase plan
* Paid time for vacation, volunteering, and 28-day sabbatical after every 5 years of service for eligible positions
* Paid parental leave and family building benefits
* Tuition reimbursement
* Health, dental, and vision insurance
company_description: Financial services can be complicated. At Charles Schwab, we’re trying to fix that.

title: Reconstruction Manager
Insurance Restoration Manager
description:
**Are you looking for an environment that allows for independence, freedom and change? Our company is in need of a proactive and assertive leader who will educate and train our reconstruction project manager team to take us to the next level.**  

  

The Director of Reconstruction Services is responsible for leading and managing the Reconstruction Project Managers. The Director manages the project managers who are responsible for the production of work from the initial inspection to the completion of the project and punch list as well as overseeing the subcontractors performing the work in the field. The purpose of Director's role is to work with the team to achieve the company's strategic business objectives.  

  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Lead and manage our Reconstruction Project Management team.
* Participate in production and other team meetings as needed.
* Work with the Project Managers to ensure the customer experience is seamless and each team member is being held accountable for their role.
* Recruit, and train project managers to ensure they are properly onboarded, managed and offboarded when necessary.
* Lead all sales presentations to potential new customers, bringing together representatives from throughout the company for sales meetings
* Ensure project managers are uploading proper documents and photos into projects.
* Make bi-weekly visits to job sites to check quality and ensure customer satisfaction and high NPS scores.
* Ensure that scheduling systems are in place and are being used effectively to achieve cycle time and gross margin goals.
* Ensure work order systems are being utilized to preserve margin
* Monitor approved sub-contractor list for all project managers and terminate sub-contractors who do not meet Paul Davis standards
* Establish and maintain a communication protocol with Project Managers to ensure customer and internal/stakeholder communication is frequent and accurate.
* Address any service-related issues quickly and bring to resolution. Escalate issues that cannot be immediately resolved.
* Utilize vendors and trade resources to continually educate the team and sharpen their skills.
* If volume is high or a difficult project comes in, the Director must be willing to step in and manage projects as necessary.
* Perform GS&R bi-weekly reviews with all project managers
* Perform performance reviews for all employees on team
* Ensure PPE is being worn properly by all employees
* Actively Participate in EOS process
* Manage after-action reporting to ensure job profitability

.
  

  

**Why The Team Needs You?** Serving others in their time of need is not easy. We will need you to build foundational relationships based on trust, actively listen, and find ways to manage a team to complete projects successfully. We also want a fun personality that enjoys getting results and helping people.
  

**Why Join The Team?** Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and both commercial and residential properties throughout the U.S. and Canada. Paul Davis Restoration of Metro New York is headquartered in Queens and serves the broader New York City Metropolitan Area. We are growing locally and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We view every Project Manager as a long-term hire. We hire only dedicated “A Players”, with the goal of developing them into experts in the field and future leaders in our company. We provide excellent professional training and a great company culture. The vast majority of our employees have been with us for over 5 years.  

  

**Our Values:** Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.  

  

**Our Vision:** To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.  

  

**Our Mission:** To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.  

  

**Competencies – Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**  

* 10 + years of experience in a service, restaurant or construction business with a leadership role is required
* Prior experience as a construction project manager, estimator, or insurance adjuster are strong pluses (but must be willing to learn a new process). Industry certifications, such as IICRC, Lead, Mold, etc. also preferred. If limited experience but you meet all qualifications, we will invest in your training!
* Sound knowledge of construction best practices, general building codes, and various building types and systems
* Solid technical background with understanding or hands on experience with software programs including: Microsoft Office, Excel, Google Suite with and the ability to learn and use new software
* Excellent time management and attention to details

**Compensation and Benefits:**  

  

* Compensation Range: $80k to >$120k, consisting of a combination of base salary, stipends, year-end bonus, performance-based bonus, and/or profit-sharing.
* Health insurance (medical, dental, and vision coverage offered), disability insurance, and HSA.
* 401(k) with company matching.
* PTO, sick days, and paid holidays.
* Generous monthly cell phone allowance, car allowance, gas and toll reimbursements, etc.


  

 Please apply if you think you have what it takes to serve others and deliver a world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.  

  

**We love to support and hire Veterans and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!**
