title: Case Manager
company: Volunteers of America- Greater New York, Inc.
description:
Volunteers of America-Greater New York (VOA-Greater New York) is an anti-poverty organization working to end homelessness in the New York area by 2050. We operate over 60 programs across New York City, Northern New Jersey and Westchester County including emergency, transitional and permanent housing. Our services extend to families experiencing homelessness, survivors of domestic violence, people living with HIV/AIDS, veterans, youth aging out of foster care, adults with behavioral health or substance use needs, and others in need, including a special education preschool program.
  
  

We are in search of new talent in the following position…
  
  

**Position:** Case Manager
  
  

The Case Manager is a key provider of services within Volunteers of America’s Case Management Model. The Case Manager works with the resident to assess their strengths and needs, plan a course of action, link the resident to services, counsel the resident and monitor progress. S/he must assure that residents receive appropriate, competent, and professional information and advice, referrals and advocacy services to achieve successful outcomes.
  
  

East Clarke Place Senior Residence program supports seniors who are chronically homeless who will also benefit from a comprehensive range of supportive services. To learn more about the program, copy and paste this link into a browser
  
https://www.voa-gny.org/east-clarke-place
  
  

**Location:** 112 East Clarke Place, Bronx NY 10452
  
  

**Minimum Qualifications:**  

* The position requires a bachelor’s degree or 60 college credits plus two years relevant experience.
* The position also requires two years of experience working with the homeless and/or senior population, a demonstrated ability in verbal and written communication, including basic computer skills.


**Case Manager Principal Responsibilities:**  

1. Manage the resident intake and assessment process to orient the resident to the program and produce a comprehensive assessment of resident service needs.
  
2. Develop with the resident a mutually agreed-upon individual service plan reflecting assessment findings goals. Update the plan with the resident as required.
  
3. Meet regularly with the resident to assist him/her in obtaining needed services/benefits to achieve their individual service plan goals. Provide supportive counseling to strengthen his/her ability to make appropriate life decisions.
  
4. Document case management activities in accordance with agency and funder guidelines and procedures. Collect service data and participate in evaluation and quality assurance activities.
  
5. Provide crisis intervention and emergency response and make the necessary and appropriate referrals and linkages.
  
  

Employees receive an exceptional benefits package including
  
* Medical
* Dental
* Vision
* Prescription coverage
* Life insurance
* Retirement plan
* Educational Reimbursement Program (includes tuition and license/certification)
* Paid Time Off which is accrued monthly and rolls over from year to year. In addition:
* Paid Birthday Holiday


And much more...
  
  

To learn more about VOA-Greater New York, copy and paste this link into a browser: https://www.voa-gny.org/about
  
  

VOA-Greater New York is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Vets/Disabled/Other Protected Categories. Apply today!

title: Client Care Worker/Residential Aide
company: Volunteers of America- Greater New York, Inc.
description:
Volunteers of America-Greater New York (VOA-Greater New York) is an anti-poverty organization working to end homelessness in the New York area by 2050. We operate over 60 programs across New York City, Northern New Jersey and Westchester County including emergency, transitional and permanent housing. Our services extend to families experiencing homelessness, survivors of domestic violence, people living with HIV/AIDS, veterans, youth aging out of foster care, adults with behavioral health or substance use needs, and others in need, including a special education preschool program.
  
  

We are in search of new talent in the following position…
  
  

**Position:** Residential Aide
  
  

The Residential Aide meets the needs of the program clients and promotes client participation in services leading to successful graduation to independent living. Residential Aides perform a wide variety of tasks including overseeing program operations, protecting client rights, promoting client and co-worker safety, transporting clients as needed and ensuring client adherence to rules and program activities.
  
  

Jamaica Women’s Employment Shelter is a transitional shelter for women who are experiencing homelessness and are employed or deemed employable, and; referred by the New York City Department of Homeless Services (DHS). To learn more about the program, copy and paste this link into a browser https://www.voa-gny.org/housing
  
  

**Location:** 95–10 218th Street • Queens Village, NY 11429
  
  

**Minimum Qualifications:**  

* High school diploma or GED preferred plus one-year relevant experience.
* Clean and valid driver’s license preferred.


**Residential Aide Principal Responsibilities:**  

1. Supervise client participation in daily program activities, monitor observance of client’s rights and client adherence to program rules and routines. Escort clients to appointments, manage bed assignments, collect census data, distribute client linens and supplies.
  
2. Maintain knowledge of service models. Communicate with case management staff and perform assigned tasks related to model service delivery.
  
3. Make scheduled rounds of assigned areas to safeguard clients and property and promote appropriate behavior. Provide emergency response including crisis management, first aid, CPR, and fire response as needed.
  
4. Report any instances of violations of client rights, incidents involving clients’ non-compliance of rules and regulations and any criminal activity promptly to the supervisor. Complete Incident Reports as outlined by the Program Manual and Funder guidelines.
  
5. Drive agency vehicles to transport clients, staff, and materials, if assigned.
  
  

**Employees receive an exceptional benefits package including:**  

* Medical
* Dental
* Vision
* Prescription coverage
* Life insurance,
* Retirement plan
* Educational Reimbursement Program (includes tuition and license/certification)
* Paid Time Off which is accrued monthly and rolls over from year to year. In addition:
* Paid Birthday Holiday


And much more…

title: Medical Receptionist/Front Desk
description:
Walk-in Dermatology is a rapidly expanding healthcare company combining traditional dermatology with the convenience of urgent care. We are looking for experienced Medical Receptionists to work the front desk and handle administrative tasks in our brand new office in Nanuet.

This is a fantastic opportunity to apply your skills in an environment where you’ll play a key role in the success of the company and where you’ll be rewarded for your contribution. In addition to getting a generous compensation package, you’ll get a full suite of benefits including healthcare insurance, paid vacation, and 401K. This is your opportunity to work with an entrepreneurial team dedicated to having fun and improving dermatology care (Just check our Google reviews to see why patients LOVE us).

**Responsibilities include:**

* Answer the office phone lines, including incoming calls and outgoing calls
* Register new patients and enter all information into our practice management software
* Check-in/Check-out patients
* Appointment scheduling
* Process payments (co-pays, self pays, and balances)
* Insurance verification, referral verification, and authorizations
* Ensure terrific patient satisfaction

**Required Experience:**

* 2 years working as a medical receptionist (dermatology experience a plus but not mandatory)
* Using EMR and Practice Management systems
* Knowledge of commercial insurances and Medicare
* Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
* Ability to work independently
* Ability to prioritize in a busy atmosphere

If you have relevant experience and are a team player, we’d like to hear from you.

We offer a full benefits package, including healthcare insurance, vacation, and 401K. Salary will be commensurate with experience. Interested candidates should reply with a resume and cover letter.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $26.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Retirement plan
* Uniform allowance
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Dermatology

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Medical receptionist: 2 years (Required)
* Dermatology: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Director of Reconstruction
Part-time Psychotherapist (remote) LMHC, LMFT, LMSW
description:
We are seeking a passionate and dedicated psychotherapist with a strong focus on couples therapy. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience and competence in working with couples, while also being comfortable and skilled in providing therapy to individual clients as needed. We value therapists who practice with ethical integrity, compassion, and a commitment to ongoing professional growth.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Maintain and manage a caseload of diverse clients, with a primary focus on couples, while also providing individual therapy when appropriate.
* Conduct therapeutic sessions with a high degree of empathy, professionalism, and adherence to ethical standards.
* Accurately maintain clinical records and documentation in compliance with legal and ethical guidelines.
* Collaborate with clients to set goals and work through therapeutic challenges, ensuring a client-centered approach.
* Stay informed on best practices and emerging trends in couples therapy and related areas.

**Benefits:**

* Flexible, remote work environment – manage your own schedule.
* Competitive compensation package.
* Minimal administrative paperwork, allowing more focus on clinical work.
* Access to clinical supervision and a supportive professional community.
* Opportunities for continued professional development and growth.

**Requirements:**

* Current license to practice psychotherapy in New York (LMSW, LMHC, LCSW, LMFT).
* Minimum of two years of clinical experience, with a strong background in treating couples and individuals.
* Proficiency with ICD-10 diagnostic codes and familiarity with HIPAA regulations preferred.
* Commitment to ethical practice, professional development, and client well-being.

title: Baker
description:
Job Overview:

Noona’s Ice Cream is opening an ice cream bake shop in Manhattan! We are looking for a skilled baker to join our team. This is an opportunity to join a small but mighty team of people that are passionate about making delicious sweet treats while adding joy and something different and impactful to the community.

The ideal candidate will have a passion for baking, ice cream making, cake decorating and making delicious pretty sweet treats. As a Baker, you will be responsible for preparing a variety of sweet baked items and frozen desserts ensuring quality and freshness for our customers.

Duties:

- Prepare and bake a select range of baked goods such as cakes and cookies as well as ice cream.  
- Mold, Assemble and Decorate cakes and cookies.

- Piping details for cakes  
- Follow recipes and adhere to food safety standards.  
- Package finished products for display or sale  
- Maintain cleanliness and organization in the kitchen

Qualifications:

- Experience in a bakery or food production environment  
- Knowledge of food handling and safety procedures

- Food Handlers Certificate  
- Proficiency in using kitchen tools including knives  
- Familiarity with piping and pastry techniques  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment  
- Strong attention to detail and quality

If you are passionate about baking and love ice cream and have the skills to create delectable treats, we invite you to apply for the Baker position with us.

Visit www.noonasicecream.com and our instagram @noonasicecream to learn more about us.

* Flexible schedule

* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid time off
* Store discount
* Vision insurance

* Evening shift
* Morning shift
* Night shift
* Weekends as needed

title: Swim Instructor (American Red Cross: Water Safety Instructor)
description:
**Swim Instructor**   
Aquatic Solutions strives to ensure communities are safe and well informed. We provide an array of education programs from American Red Cross CPR/AED/First Aid courses to Swim Instruction and Aquatic Courses. Aquatic Solutions is searching for knowledgeable, reliable, and passionate American Red Cross Water Safety Instructors dedicated to teaching the American Red Cross Learn to Swim Program. Aquatic Solutions offers staff advancement opportunities based on experience, performance, and demonstrated abilities.

**Position Description**  
All candidates must possess a current American Red Cross Water Safety Instructor certification and be comfortable teaching the American Red Cross Learn to Swim Program. Shifts and work times may vary based on availability and client schedule. Please note, this is a preliminary search and the position is pending a contract agreement.

**Job Duties and Responsibilities**

* Instructs swim lessons according to the American Red Cross Learn to Swim Program
* Responds to participant questions, comments, and concerns
* Provides a safe, clean, and organized work space

**Position Requirements**

* Minimum age of 16 years old
* American Red Cross Water Safety Instructor (Required)
* American Red Cross CPR, First Aid, and Lifeguard Certifications (Preferred)
* Swim lesson instruction or coaching experience (Preferred)
* Ability to swim and demonstrate the following skill:

1. Front Crawl, Back Crawl - 25 yards (Required)

2. Breaststroke, Elementary Backstroke, Sidestroke – 25 yards (Required)

3. Butterfly – 15 yards (Required)

4. Back float for 1 minute (floating or sculling) (Required)

5. Tread water for 1 minute (Required)

6. Must be comfortable working with adults and children (Both preferred).

7. Instructors will be required to be in the water during their lessons.

8. All offers of employment at Aquatic Solutions are contingent upon clear results of a thorough background check. Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates and on all employees who are promoted, as deemed necessary.

9. COVID-19 Vaccination (Highly Preferred)

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $22.00 - $24.00 per hour

Schedule:

* After school
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Emergency Recovery Coordinator
description:
The **Emergency Recovery Coordinator** will consult with property owners impacted by fire water damage or other large-scale emergency events. This role will work closely with Emergency Response Agencies to enable effective implementation of property recovery initiatives. This role must have a desire to help others above all.  

  

**Paul Davis** provides professional residential and commercial emergency restoration services for disasters of all sizes. From water and flood damage, to fire damage and mold remediation, Paul Davis franchise professionals are available 24/7 to clean up and repair damage to residential and commercial property. Founded in 1966, Paul Davis is a rapidly growing network of more than 370 independently owned and operated franchises in the United States and Canada. Paul Davis will grow to become over a $2 Billion business in the next 5 years.  

  

**Position:** Emergency Recovery Coordinator  

**Hours/Week:** Full-time, 40+ hours  

**Compensation:**  

* Strong base salary commensurate with experience plus commission
* Bonus opportunities
* Medical, dental and vision coverage offered
* 401(k) with company match
* PTO, sick days and paid holidays
* Cell phone and computer provided by company

**Reports To:** Marketing Manager  

**Summary**: Does the idea of working on interesting and complex projects bring you joy? Are you challenged by making a meaningful impact? Do you love solving problems by thinking creatively and trying new things? Are you an up-and-coming manager who always wants to do better? If so, we've got what you're looking for! The Emergency Recovery Coordinator will consult with property owners impacted by fire water damage or other large-scale emergency events. This role will work closely with Emergency Response Agencies to enable effective implementation of property recovery initiatives. This role must have a desire to help others above all.  

  

**Responsibilites:** Emergency Recovery Coordinator  

The Emergency Recovery Coordinator will consult with property owners impacted by fire, water damage or other large-scale emergency events  

* Deliver an experience of extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need
* Responds to emergency property situations and all generated leads
* CLOSE opportunities on the spot
* Educates the consumer on products or services
* Build relationships and communicate Paul Davis services
* Monitor, generate and interpret lead sources (emergency notification systems)
* Provide emergency recovery kits and services to impacted property owners
* Establish and maintain working relationships with local emergency response agencies and local community
* Participate in community events
* Build and maintain a database of customer information
* Manage data in our main operating systems, RMS
* All other duties as assigned

**Skills and Knowledge:**  

* Self-motivated to get results
* SALES-ORIENTED and CLOSE-driven
* Loves working with clients and tradesman
* Effectively schedules ahead while maintaining flexibility
* Thrives under high performance environments
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Is succinct and professional with written communication
* Enjoys taking care of others

**Required Education and Experience:**  

* High School Diploma or GED required
* Four plus years’ experience in the following areas (any combination): restoration, military, fire services, EMS, police, medical responder, dispatching of emergency responders, construction, insurance
* Two plus years’ experience in an outside sales role or customer service role
* Outside sales

  

Paul Davis is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Secretary III, Ad Sales Legal
description:
**bout the Role & Team**
------------------------


At Disney, we‘re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, products, interactive games, parks and resorts, and media networks. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.


The Ad Sales Legal team is looking for a Secretary III to join their team in New York. The Assistant carries out a range of duties under the supervision of the Deputy Chief Counsel and four other attorneys. The position assists attorneys with all facets of administrative support for the Ad Sales Legal team which supports the Disney Advertising Sales (DAS) business segment. DAS is responsible for selling advertising for all of Disney’s broadcast, cable, digital and social platforms, and ad-supported streaming services including the ABC Television Network, ESPN, FX, the ABC-owned television stations, National Geographic, Freeform, Disney+, ESPN+, and Hulu.


We are looking for a motivated, highly organized, and detail-oriented individual who can handle confidential information with discretion. The ideal candidate will be able to independently exercise good judgment, take initiative, manage multiple attorney calendars, and quickly adapt to changing events. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills are required for successful interaction with all levels of employees and external contacts.


This role contributes to the overall success of the team by coordinating complex administrative tasks with minimal direction. It involves close collaboration with other staff members, supporting the senior executive team within DAS and The Walt Disney Company Legal and Global Affairs department.

**What You Will Do**
--------------------

* Thoughtfully manage complex calendars, protecting the time of lawyers, including the Deputy Chief Counsel, through strategic and proactive calendar management and assessing various meeting requests
* Communicate (both written and verbal) with various internal Disney departments, executives, and business units
* Handle highly confidential correspondence and information with the utmost discretion while maintaining strict confidentiality with respect to all matters and documents
* Book relatively infrequent travel for the Deputy Chief Counsel and others, create travel itineraries, and manage Travel & Entertainment expenses
* Order supplies and equipment, coordinate office space, process and track payments to vendors
* Ensure lawyers are prepared for meetings and events, as necessary/requested, and conduct research and report on specific topics as needed
* Prepare materials for internal and external creative presentations (e.g., PowerPoint decks)
* Assist with onboarding new department employees
* Manage and maintain various files, databases, and filing systems
* Handle execution of contracts
* Schedule and host Zoom meetings, which may involve sharing presentations

**Required Qualifications & Skills**
------------------------------------

* At least 5 years of experience in an administrative capacity for a senior executive (VP or higher)
* Strong computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office software programs (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.), Adobe, SAP, NetDocs, comparison software, DocuSign and Concur; ability and willingness to learn and use new software and tools, including document management systems
* Ability to proactively resolve problems, anticipate needs, take initiative, prioritize, meet deadlines, and be resourceful and flexible
* Team player with strong interpersonal skills and ability to build strong relationships across multiple levels of employees and clients within and outside the organization
* Highly organized, attentive to detail, strong proofreading skills, and ability to multi-task effectively
* Ability to exercise appropriate judgment in executing tasks without supervision
* Effective communication skills (written and verbal)

**Preferred Qualifications**
----------------------------

* Experience supporting attorneys in a large law firm or large in-house legal department

**Education**
-------------

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

title: Asset Protection Specialist
description:
**About the Role & Team**


At Disney, we’re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. The Walt Disney Company is a world-class entertainment and technological leader. Walt’s passion was to continuously envision new ways to move audiences around the world—a passion that remains our touchstone in an enterprise that stretches from theme parks, resorts, and a cruise line to sports, news, movies, and a variety of other businesses. Uniting each endeavor is a commitment to creating and delivering unforgettable experiences — and we’re constantly looking for new ways to enhance and protect these exciting experiences!


We are seeking an Asset Protection Agent to aid the Disney Store Cast in supporting a safe and secure environment for Cast Members and Guests! This is accomplished through proactive deterrence, identification, and resolution associated with suspicious activity and potential unsafe behaviors.


This role reports to the Asset Protection Manager with daily oversight by Store Leadership.


This position is located at our Times Square Disney Store in New York.

**What You Will Do**
--------------------

* Act as a visible deterrent to potential risk at store entrances/exits and throughout the store to maintain high visibility while monitoring and responding to any escalated incidents of suspicious activity, unsafe behaviors, and other potential workplace security concerns
* Use specialty training related to Retail Counter-Terrorism and Workplace Security Programs to identify, deter, and report activity related to aggressive behavior, civil unrest protests, imminent threats, terrorism, etc.
* Conduct onsite security and safety inspections (in-person and via CCTV where applicable), respond to raised and identified risks to Store Leadership and Corporate Asset Protection
* Support emergency preparedness and crisis response programs to help mitigate potential impacts
* Support Cast and Guest needs and promote a risk-adverse culture
* Assist store Cast with response to Electronic Article Surveillance (EAS) activations when needed
* Conduct camera and alarm monitoring, related incident notification, investigation, trend analysis, and case management documentation
* Conduct Cast Member and vendor site access security screening related to bag/package/coat inspections
* Act as law enforcement liaison and the security/safety point of contact for regional industry and partners
* Demonstrate and act following Disney values, behaviors, and guidelines

**Required Qualifications & Skills**
------------------------------------

* Asset Protection /Loss Prevention/Security experience
* Attention to detail, ability to prioritize tasks
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to lift boxes that weigh up to 40 pounds and climb a ladder
* Availability to work a flexible schedule that meets the needs of the business including evenings, holidays, and weekends

**Preferred Qualifications**
----------------------------

* Detailed understanding of Loss Prevention and Security procedures, regulations, and practices
* Has an understanding of basic Safety practices and procedures
* Experience using retail CCTV systems

**Education**
-------------

* High School Diploma or equivalent

**Additional Information**
--------------------------


Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

title: Media Planner
description:
The Media Planning Team at ESPN develops innovative media plans that drive awareness, consumption, subscriptions, and brand affinity across all properties and platforms to affect the ESPN business.


The Media Planner will focus on supporting the holistic media strategy and planning of the ESPN Marketing portfolio across owned and paid media, plus TWDC networks. The Media Planner takes pleasure in getting to “do it all”, supporting projects that blur the lines between marketing, research, operations and creative. This role provides foundational experience in how the world of media operates in the fast paced environment of multiplatform live sports and content.


The ideal candidate possesses outstanding organizational and communication skills, has superior attention to detail, can provide objective analysis, has the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, work with autonomy, maintain a relentless curiosity to understand how everything connects, all while meeting deadlines. This position will report to the Associate Manager, Media Strategy & Planning and collaborate closely with others in the group, as well as across ESPN and The Walt Disney Company.


Individual must enjoy working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with a proven ability to handle a high-volume workload and navigate a matrixed organization with a positive attitude and a solutions oriented mindset.


**Responsibilities**:

* Responsible for supporting Media Planning & Buying leads and contributing to media plans across multiple sports
* Coordinate campaign logistics to ensure timely execution
* Create and maintain key planning documents
* Steward effective communication and understand needs across marketing, creative and external media agencies to lead campaign spec sheets & deliverables, campaign timelines and assist in the trafficking process to ensure timely launch of media campaigns across ESPN channels and paid media
* Monitor and assess ongoing campaign performance; assist in strategic analysis of campaigns
* Assist with tracking and management of the media budget, which may include, but not limited to receive and log invoices, complete monthly accrual process, facilitate creation of POs for billing, etc.
* Responsible for compiling data for dashboards/Excel trackers, as needed, ensuring accuracy and validity of data shown
* Stay on top of sports industry trends, ad products, consumer and viewing behaviors to inform Media plans; provide point of view on relevant marketing campaigns

**Qualifications**:

* 1+ years of professional experience in integrated media planning (brand, corporate, agency or publisher side preferred) or strong internship experience in marketing or media entertainment also relevant
* Knowledge of media channels and experience coordinating across multiple media disciplines with a heavy focus on TV/CTV/Social/Digital for full funnel marketing plans
* Effective collaborative and interpersonal skills
* Genuine interest in sports and is excited to influence and impact the fan experience
* Extremely organized and motivated, with the ability to effectively prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Works with urgency, proficient time management, problem solving skills and a critical thinker

**Preferred Qualifications**:

* Strong entertainment industry knowledge, preferably in sports
* Multi-platform paid media experience
* Ability to prioritize and multi-task
* Outstanding interpersonal skills (verbal and written)
* Curiosity and passion for understanding the “why” underneath the surface
* Conscientious

**Required Education**:

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Media, Marketing, or a related field

title: Water/Mold/Fire Project Manager
description:
**What does a Water/Mold/Fire Project Manager with Paul Davis do?**  

  

* Serve your community when it needs it the most.
* Communicate with customers and adjusters the scope and expectations of a restoration project.
* Continuously learn about scoping, signing and managing construction projects, and improving results.
* Celebrate completion of projects with a team of skilled tradespeople, homeowners grateful to be back in their homes, and your Paul Davis team members.
* Have fun and be part of a growing business!

**Water/Mold/Fire Project Manager's** work with homeowners, businesses, adjusters, and sub-contractors after traumatic events such as fire or flood to clean up and repair damage to residential and commercial properties., you will be on scene after property disasters to accurately scope projects, sign up the work, and oversee the execution of the restoration project (while controlling and communicating the budget effectively). This is an incredibly dynamic role, in which you will build relationships with insurance professionals, be the frontline contact with homeowners and set their expectations for restoring their properties back to health, manage your own budgets, and direct the work of Technicians and subcontractors. Your time will be spent both in the office as well as in the field to see your projects get completed properly.  

  

**Why The Team Needs You?** Serving others in their time of need is not easy. We will need you to build foundational relationships based on trust, actively listen, and find ways to manage a team to complete projects successfully. We also want a fun personality that enjoys getting results and helping people.  

  

**Why Join the Team?** Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and both commercial and residential properties throughout the U.S. and Canada. Paul Davis Restoration of Metro New York / New Jersey is headquartered in Queens, and has additional offices in Bergen County, NJ and in Manhattan. We serve the broader New York City, Long Island, and Northeastern New Jersey (Bergen, Hudson, Essex, etc.) areas. We have been consistently growing and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We view every Estimator as a long-term hire. We hire only dedicated “A Players”, with the goal of developing them into experts in the field and future leaders in our company. We provide excellent professional training and a great company culture. The vast majority of our employees have been with us for over 5 years.  

  

**Our Values:** Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.  

  

**Our Vision:** To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.  

  

**Our Mission:** To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.  

  

**Qualifications (Requirements):**  

  

* High character with uncompromising commitment to honesty and integrity.
* Hungry and self-motivated, with a strong sense of ownership and responsibility.
* Willingness to respond to client/project needs, and genuine desire to help people in distress.
* Thrives under high performance, meritocratic environments.
* Strong attention to details, organizational skills, time management, and project management skills.
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills.
* Ability to lead and develop teams.
* Career emphasis on learning and continuing education.
* Proficiency with current mobile and computing technology, and ability to learn new software.
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent relevant experience.
* Clean driving record and a reliable car (company pays generous car allowance and gas/toll reimbursements).

**Prior experience as a restoration project manager, construction project manager, estimator, or insurance adjuster are strong pluses** (but must be willing to learn a new process). Industry certifications or licenses (such as IICRC, Lead, Mold, etc.) also strongly preferred. If limited experience but you meet all qualifications, we will invest in your training!  

  

**Role on the Team (Job Functions):**  

  

* Meet operational objectives of: Sales, Gross Margin, Brand Experience, etc.
* Profitably scope, estimate, and sign projects to get started, then create work orders and manage the entire execution of the project while managing your own budget.
* Ensure compliance with regulations, standards, and service level agreements.
* Build relationships with insurance professionals, TPAs, and customers (both direct and B2B).
* Recruit, develop, and manage subcontractors/tradesmen; develop partnerships and improve team performance.

**Compensation and Benefits:**  

  

* Significant opportunities for professional growth – 3 to 6 months of structured training to learn the Paul Davis Way, ongoing Leadership Development Program, 1-on-1 mentorship, and access to Paul Davis University and other regular ongoing training opportunities.
* Emotionally rewarding career. Not only are you helping people in time of need, but once fully ramped up, you will be given an extraordinary amount of autonomy and control over your work – fully trusted by the company to function as a "mini-CEO": managing your own budgets and teams, setting your own schedule, honing your style, and developing personal relationships (but with full support and mentorship from the company along the way);
* Highly competitive compensation structure, with base salary plus uncapped commissions based on projects completed. Our current Water/Mold/Fire Project Manager's yearly total compensations range from $50k (base salary before any commission, paid weekly) to >$200k depending on production. Candidates with significant prior experience as restoration project managers may qualify to start immediately as Senior Water/Mold/Fire Project Manager at higher base salary. Regardless of seniority, there is no limit to earning potential! We believe in meritocracy and rewarding high performers!
* Eligible for full benefits (an initial qualification period may apply), including: health, dental, vision and disability insurances; earned vacation and sick days; 401(k) with company matching; HSA with company matching; and additional annual performance-based bonuses.
* Generous monthly cell phone allowances, car allowances, gas and toll reimbursements, etc.

The physical environment requires the employee to work all types of both indoor and outdoor conditions. Sometimes required to use personal protective equipment.  

  

Please apply if you think you have what it takes to serve others and deliver a world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.  

  

**We love to support and hire Veterans, and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!**

title: Youth Mentor/Recreation Specialist
description:
Reporting to the Director of Community-Based Services, The Youth Mentor/Recreation Specialist will play a vital role in both the College Program and The Community-Based Services Department in this dual role. The Youth Mentor will work closely with an interdisciplinary team, as well as stakeholders to ensure that students are integrating into college life, academics, and internship. Youth Mentors will work closely with their assigned students to provide social, emotional, and logistical assistance throughout their college experience. They will work with students throughout the milestones of the program. The Recreation Specialist is responsible for supervising participants in the recreation program during various outings and activities in the community. The Recreation Specialist should be comfortable working with people with I/DD and assists the consumers to actively participate in events, provides transportation, administers medication if applicable, and provides any other assistance or support as needed. We need the Recreation Specialist to be organized and possess a broad range of skills. They should also be comfortable working in a variety of settings, as they may be asked to participate in or oversee activities.

Responsibilities

Youth Mentor

● Model pro-social behavior, strong academic habits, and dedication to work

● Assist students with navigating travel around campus, extracurricular activities, and internship

● Ensure integration into campus life by encouraging and attending clubs and teams with students

● Ensure success in classes by attending with students, managing behaviors, and advocating for students, as needed

● Provide homework assistance and/or coordinate tutoring services as needed

● Link students to needed campus resources

● Attend office hours and/or additional academic support services with students, as needed

● Provide 1:1 guidance and encouragement to students

● Attend all team, agency, and relevant meetings and trainings

● Develop working relationships with key stakeholders in students’ life

● Provide immediate assistance for any medical and/or safety concern

● Monitor the safety and well-being of students

● Plan and coordinate enrichment classes in Campus and outside of Campus.

● Ensure compliance with any funder or program related benchmark or milestone

● Develop and maintain student Individual Service Plans to track goals and progress

● Work closely with the Coach to develop strong interventions for struggling students

● Tend to tasks as needed Recreation Specialist

● Plan community-based activities for groups of consumers

● Assist in the coordination, planning, and purchasing needed for any scheduled activity.

● Lead Educational activities and college events for consumers

● Escort and oversee consumers who are 18+

● Attend trainings that will increase general and related knowledge of developmental disabilities

● Resolve occasional behavioral issues

● Make sure all safety rules are followed

● Supervise and engage participants in a variety of social skills development events.

● Perform first aid or take care of injuries as needed

● Keep accurate incident logs

● Provide input to the Supervisor in planning community activities. Skills

● Familiarity with various indoor and outdoor activities

● Patient, reliable and trustworthy

● Organizational and communication skills

● Energetic and positive personality

● Ability to meet the physical demands of the job

● First aid- and CPR-certified preferred

● Must work with minimal supervision. Qualifications: Education/Experience

● Bachelor’s degree preferred

● Proven experiences as a Recreation Aid or similar working with the community

● Valid driver’s license

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.00 - $18.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off

* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

* 8 hour shift

title: Registered Nurse

 **Position Overview:** Join our dynamic outpatient clinic in Oceanport, NJ, where you will provide both direct and indirect nursing care to a geriatric population. This role offers a Monday to Friday-schedule with no weekends, ensuring a great work-life balance! You will work under the supervision of the Clinical Services Supervisor, utilizing advanced nursing knowledge to manage complex clinical situations effectively.

You can also call/text (925) 290-7974. I strive to reply within 1 - 2 hours. Looking forward to connecting with you soon. Thank you!

title: Mitigation Technician
description:
**WHAT DOES A MITIGATION TECHNICIAN WITH PAUL DAVIS DO?**  

* Serve others within your community in their time of need.
* Make a difference for others that have had a disaster strike their property.
* Work hard and take pride in completing projects (i.e. mitigating flood and fire damage).
* Be empathetic and show a sense of urgency while communicating through modern technology.


  

**WHY JOIN THE TEAM?** Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and both commercial and residential properties throughout the U.S. and Canada. Paul Davis Restoration of Metro New York is headquartered in Queens and serves the broader New York City Metropolitan Area. We are growing locally and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We view every Mitigation Technician as a long-term hire. We hire only dedicated “A Players”, with the goal of developing them to become experts in the field and future leaders in our company. We provide excellent professional training and a great company culture. Our employees are all treated with love, respect, and appreciation. The vast majority of our employees have been with us for over five years.  

  

Mitigation Technicians will be responsible for providing on-site services to our customers, and will work in teams alongside Senior Technicians, Supervisors, and Management. Mitigation Technicians will be in frontline contact with customers during projects and must represent the company in a positive manner that builds customers’ confidence and trust in our work. Primary tasks include: (1) evaluating and recording damages to a building caused by water, fire, mold, storm, etc.; (2) cleaning and restoring damaged structures, using our professional and specialized equipment and techniques; (3) directly communicating with customers and coordinating with the Paul Davis team to provide extraordinary customer care; and (4) embodying our office’s core values of honesty, integrity, and safety. Mitigation Technicians may also from time to time be asked to support other aspects of our office's operations and growth strategy.  

  

**OUR VALUES:** Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.  

  

**OUR VISION:** To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.  

  

**OUR MISSION:** To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.  

  

  

**WHY THE TEAM NEEDS YOU?** Serving others after a disaster has struck their property is not easy. Everyone within Paul Davis needs to have a world-class work ethic, serious attention to detail and love to help people. You will love being a technician if you take pride in your work and have a genuine interest in learning and helping others.  

  

**Reports To: Mitigation Manager**  

  

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS:**  

* High character with uncompromising commitment to honesty and integrity.
* Hardworking attitude, and adaptability to work hours that sometimes can be long or irregular (including on weekends).
* Ability to operate in hazardous environments with care and safety.
* Strong attention to details.
* Genuine desire to help other people.
* Demonstrated record of responsibility, teamwork, and respect for people and properties.
* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Legal authorization to work in the U.S.


  

**PREFERRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCES:**  

* 2-4 years of post-high-school education/training, or an honorable discharge from the U.S. Armed Forces.
* Construction, renovation, or handyman experience and knowledge.
* Technical proficiency with smart phones and tablets, and ability to learn new software and tools.
* Strong communication skills (both oral and written).
* Desire to learn new things and growth within the company.
* Ability to manage other people and projects.
* If limited experience but you meet all Position Requirements, it's okay; we will invest in your training!


  

**COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:**  

* Highly competitive hourly wage (varies based on experience level and personal growth), with significant opportunity for overtime pay each week.
* All employees paid weekly!
* Eligible for full benefits after 90 days of employment, including health and disability insurance, earned vacation days and sick days, 401(k) with company matching, monthly cellphone allowance, and additional annual performance-based bonuses.
* Significant cross-training and career growth opportunities!


  

**NOTE:** If you have relevant previous experience and IICRC certifications, you may be eligible to start immediately as a Senior Mitigation Technician (and earn even higher pay).  

  

Please apply if you think you have what it takes to be a team-player and deliver world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.  

  

**We love to support and hire Veterans, and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!**

title: Operations Controller
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are looking for a hands-on, experienced, roll up your sleeves Operations/Finance Controller to manage various departments for the Company. This position reports to the CFO and has significant emphasis on warehouse operations as well internal controls and interaction with management team.

**Responsibilities**  
-Hands-on management of warehouse daily activities, receiving, inventory and front-end department and warehouse personnel.

-Proactively oversee Warehouse Inbound Receiving Appointments in anticipation of schedule conflicts, cancellations, weather, holiday demands etc.

-Effectively lead cross-functional root cause and corrective action to resolve customer-related issues with regards to warehouse operations

-Oversee accuracy of inventory cycle counts and audits

-Ensures that physical inventory reconciliation, analysis and reporting are accurate and executed within established timeline.

-Oversee accuracy of Customer Returns

title: Laboratory Supervisor - 24-675
description:
Atlas is a nationwide leader in civil engineering, materials testing and geotechnical consulting services for environmental, industrial and infrastructure construction projects. Headquartered in Austin, TX, Atlas currently has over 3,500 employees in offices throughout the US. It’s no accident that Atlas creates a better experience for infrastructure and environmental projects. It’s how we are built – with the best people in the industry, with the reach and expertise to help at any and every step of the project, and with a heart-led approach that puts quality and safety at the center of everything we do. We’re just built to be better. We are a great company. Come join us!

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

* The Laboratory Supervisor will assist in managing all activities related to performance of laboratory testing in support of the Avenel Construction Materials Testing Laboratory.
* They will meet agreed upon project deadlines by performing testing; scheduling technicians and managing workload; They will confirm that technicians correctly perform testing, calibrations, and calculations and computations by implementing and maintaining the requirements of the Atlas Quality Management System; and train, coordinate and supervise assigned staff.
* Works independently, using industry knowledge to solve problems of moderate scope.
* Will be responsible for daily laboratory activities in the absence of the Laboratory Manager.
* The successful candidate will bring strong leadership and knowledge of commercial laboratory operations.

**Minimum Requirements:**

* 5+ years of experience with laboratory testing of construction materials.
* 1+ year of experience as a Lab Manager or Supervisor (preferred)
* Valid driver's license and ability to pass drug and MVR
* High School Diploma or equivalent.
* Associates Degree or Higher in Construction Technology, Construction Management or Related Engineering Field (preferred)
* Ability to work independently and as a team member, maintaining composure, and working effectively in a high-pressure environment with changing priorities.
* Must have excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
* Able to use a company provided laptop or tablet computer and a working knowledge of MS Office programs (e.g. Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.).
* Organization and multi-tasking ability.
* A good work ethic, attention to detail, and high level of personal integrity.

**Technical Requirements:**

* American Concrete Institute (ACI) Certifications:

Aggregate Testing Technician - Level 1 or 2  
Aggregate/Soils Base Testing Technician  
Concrete Strength Testing Technician  
Concrete Field-Testing Technician - Grade 1  
Concrete Laboratory Testing Technician - Level 1 or 2

* National Institute for Certification in Engineering Technologies (NICET):
* Construction Materials Testing: Asphalt, Concrete, Soils (Levels I, II, or III)
* NJSAT Certifications: HMA Plant Technologist Level 1

**Other Miscellaneous Qualities:**

* Familiarity with Lab Information Management Systems (LIMS)

**ATLAS EEOC Statement** 

**Atlas Technical Consultants is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.**

**This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Atlas Technical Consultants makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time. For more information, read through our EEO Policy** https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/migrated\\_files/employers/poster\\_screen\\_reader\\_optimized.pdf

title: Medical Office Coordinator / Medical Assistant
description:
Position: Office Coordinator / Medical Assistant

Reports to: Director

Do you say, “I do it all!” When asked what you do at work? If your answer is Yes, then this job may be for you!

Easy Schedule. No Nights. No Sick Visits. NO COVID PATIENTS OR TESTING

Seeking a professional with medical office experience and a dynamic personality to join our Green Brook location as **Office Coordinator / Medical Assistant**. Candidate must be passionate about helping others, dependable, and interested in professional growth and development.

The Medi-Weightloss weight loss program was developed based on the five keys to wellness: nutrition, fitness, medicine, education, and motivation.

At Medi-Weightloss, our mission is not only to help patients achieve their weight loss goals but to help them achieve long-term wellness. We understand that wellness encompasses much more than weight loss and that is why we are always working to ensure that all aspects of our patients' health are improved while on our program. In addition to offering individualized physician-supervised weight loss programs for adults, Medi-Weightloss also offers specialized weight loss programs for adolescents and for individuals at risk of or currently are diagnosed diabetics through its Acute DM Program.

**Position Overview**

The Office Coordinator / Medical Assistant works under the direct supervision of the Director. The environment is fast-paced, and the position is multifaceted. The Director will assign additional projects and tasks.

**Essential Job Functions**

* Assist with all administrative duties including, but not limited to, answering telephones, scheduling patients, and filing medical records
* Uses the EMR to check in/out all patient visits.
* Conduct follow up calls to patients to discuss the patient’s progress and address any concerns
* Refer non-routine, sensitive and/or complex requests for information and other inquiries or complaints to the appropriate staff member.
* Ensure that each patient receives outstanding service by providing a friendly environment, which includes greeting and acknowledging every patient, maintaining outstanding standards, solid product knowledge and all other aspects of customer service.
* Process accounts receivable transactions.
* Accurately and securely maintain all financials for services rendered and products sold.
* Verify Insurance Coverage
* Responsible for verifying the accuracy of the daily receipts and developing a “daily batch”
* Assist with daily monitoring of inventory levels of all clinical and office supplies and Product Inventory
* Scan, Upload, Manage medical records

Additional responsibilities may include:

* Obtains patient's Body Composition Analysis, vitals, EKG, Phlebotomy
* Administers IM injections
* Prepares laboratory order forms
* Obtains patient laboratory results
* Documents patient progress notes in the patient chart and/or EMR

**Requirements**

* Must have experience working in a Medical, Dental, Physical Therapy, Chiropractic or similar office.
* Medical Assistant experience a plus
* Must be able to work on site in Green Brook Wednesdays 2:00 PM -7:00 PM, Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays 7:00 AM to 2:00 PM. Additional hours working remotely available.
* Experience with EMR, Scheduling, or CRM systems a plus

**Other Skills/Abilities**

* Must be able to multi-task, apply critical thinking skills, and provide highest level of customer service at all levels of the operation
* Interpersonal / human relations skills
* Ability to maintain confidentiality
* Must demonstrate excellent communication skills both oral and written
* Ability to work with as part of the clinic team and corporate structure
* Must be able to lift and carry 25+ pounds and sit for long periods of time

NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

title: Server - Upscale Restaurant Experience
description:
Responsible for providing guests with an exceptional dining experience. Must be able to multitask effectively, as they are often juggling multiple tasks at once. This includes taking orders from several tables at once, serving individual courses, clearing plates between courses, refilling drinks, etc.

* Communicating with other staff members to ensure that orders are delivered to guests in a timely manner
* Presenting food items and drink selections to customers, answering any questions they may have about the menu items, and helping them make decisions on ordering
* Suggesting additional items that can be paired with entrees based on ingredients or flavor profiles to increase sales
* Explaining the menu and specials to customers and answering any questions they may have about them
* Providing outstanding customer service to each guest by answering questions about the menu, making recommendations, and suggesting food and beverage pairings based on individual preferences and tastes
* Taking orders and serving alcoholic beverages to guests who are of legal age to drink in accordance with state liquor laws
* Greeting guests when they arrive and confirming that they have been seated or directed to the proper location for their event
* Assisting with planning events such as weddings or corporate dinners by coordinating with the event planner or catering staff throughout the process, including during setup and cleanup

Requirements:

**Communication skills:** Communication skills are essential for any server, as they allow you to interact with customers and relay information to the kitchen staff. You can use your communication skills to explain menu options, answer questions about the restaurant and take orders. You can also use your communication skills to check in with customers throughout their meal to ensure they’re satisfied with their service.

**Attention to detail:** Attention to detail is a necessary skill for any server, as it ensures that customers receive the correct order and that the restaurant makes money by charging customers for the correct items. Fine dining servers often have to pay attention to details like the type of cutlery, the temperature of the food and the ingredients in each dish.

**Food knowledge:** Food knowledge is the ability to understand the ingredients and preparation methods of various dishes. This can help you recommend dishes to customers and answer any questions they may have about the menu. You can also use food knowledge to help you prepare dishes correctly and suggest pairings for customers.

**Customer service:** Customer service is the ability to provide a positive experience for customers. As a fine dining server, you should be able to provide excellent customer service to your patrons. This includes greeting customers, answering questions, making recommendations and resolving any issues that may arise.

**Multitasking:** As a fine dining server, you may be responsible for several tables at once. This means you need to be able to multitask, switching between tables and tasks quickly and efficiently. You may also be responsible for managing multiple food orders at once, so it’s important to be able to handle multiple tasks at once.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $23.00 - $45.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 per week

Benefits:

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Evening shift

Experience:

* Upscale Restaurant: 4 years (Required)
* Serving: 6 years (Required)
* Restaurant experience: 6 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Clinical Psychologists
company: Achieve Beyond Pediatric Therapy and Autism Services
description:
We are seeking dedicated and compassionate Clinical Psychologists to join our New York City team, to work with children and families. If you are looking for a rewarding and exciting experience, please apply below. We look forward to meeting you!

**New York City Location:**


Positions are available throughout Bronx, Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn and Staten Island boroughs.


Come and join a team of passionate therapists providing excellent pediatric therapy. We specialize in conducting evaluations and providing ongoing services in homes, community, and clinic settings. Achieve Beyond is centered around a culture of collaboration and support, to ensure our services are of the highest quality and adhere to our strong ethical standards. We currently offer ABA, Speech, Occupational, Social Work, and Physical therapy as well as Special Education/SEIT services. We serve children and families in the metro New York area (all 5 boroughs of NYC, Hudson Valley, Long Island and Albany), Virginia/DC area, Maryland, New Jersey, Connecticut and Delaware.

**Benefits:**

* Flexible work schedule
* Access provided to our paperless billing and data collection system (training provided).
* Support from our team of dedicated clinical supervisors and administrative staff.
* Financial educational assistance program (when applicable).
* Available benefits include: medical, dental, vision and 401k.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Administer Psychological Evaluations in home and/or school based settings.
* Gather necessary information to conduct social histories.
* Write comprehensive evaluation reports and social histories and submit them in a timely manner.
* Write Individualized Family Service Plan (IFSP) and/or Individualized Educational Plan (IEP) goals.
* Determine need for additional assessments per observation and child needs.
* Conduct evaluations in the primary language of the child.
* Maintain confidentiality of information regarding children and families (in accordance with HIPAA and State & Federal regulations) and submit records to agency within established deadlines.

**Requirements:**

* Must have a passion for working with children and families!
* Valid NYS Clinical Psychologist license
* Must be self-motivated and a team player who exercises patience and professionalism.
* Fluency in a language other than English is a plus!

**Physical Requirements:**

* Must be able to travel to and from assigned cases, including but not limited to: driving a personal vehicle, walking and/or the use of public transportation such as a bus or train.
* The ability to ascend and descend staircases.
* The ability to lift 10 pounds regularly.
* The ability to sit on the floor, kneel and/or crawl for extended periods of time.


$166-$298 per evaluation

title: Waitstaff
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


One of the strengths that sets The Bristal apart as a luxury assisted living community is our chef-prepared cuisine and the country club dining experience we provide three times a day. We are seeking friendly, professional and, above all, compassionate **Waitstaff** with the kind, patient and cheerful spirit to deliver on that exceptional experience. You know the satisfied feeling you get at an upscale restaurant when the servers do an excellent job? That's the same feeling we wish our residents to have every day, and as part of our Waitstaff team, your performance is key to making that happen. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring all meals are served and presented in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Food Service. The loving care, attention and great customer service you bring to the dining experience are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Full Time, Part Time, and Per Diem schedules available


Additional responsibilities include:

* Patiently and cheerfully taking resident meal orders
* Checking station tables for settings and cleanliness
* Reading the menu before service so that you can knowledgeably assist the residents with their selections
* Assisting in the plating and proper portion controls of some or all of the following: appetizers, salads, soups, beverages and desserts
* Bussing tables at the end of the meal


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* Experience as a Waiter/Waitress in a restaurant or food-service-related industry
* Able to function in a fast-paced environment
* Have a strong ability to multi-task
* Possesses good communication, customer service and people skills
* Is professional, patient and able to satisfy a demanding customer base
* Experience working with a senior population is preferred, but not required
* Is a team player, willing to help out where needed to ensure a pleasurable dining experience
* Familiarity with food safety, food preparation and board of health guidelines is a plus
* Is able to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in actions and demeanor
* Maintains an abiding respect for the elderly and remains calm at all times

company: Achieve Beyond Pediatric Therapy and Autism Services
description:

**New York** **City Location:**


Positions are available throughout Bronx, Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn and Staten Island boroughs.


Come and join a team of passionate therapists providing excellent pediatric therapy. We specialize in conducting evaluations and providing ongoing services in homes, community, and clinic settings. Achieve Beyond is centered around a culture of collaboration and support, to ensure our services are of the highest quality and adhere to our strong ethical standards. We currently offer ABA, Speech, Occupational, Social Work, and Physical therapy as well as Special Education/SEIT services. * **For evaluations:** Schedule, conduct and submit evaluation reports and documents on time including suggested revisions
* **For services:** Educate families and caregivers on applicable intervention strategies to facilitate active involvement and carry-over.
* Work in diverse settings such as client homes, daycare homes/centers, preschools, clinics, and other community settings.

title: Lifestyle Coordinator
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a creative, compassionate, hands-on **Lifestyle Coordinator** to assist in presenting and coordinating recreational programs for our assisted living residents, as well as residents with Alzheimer's disease or dementia in our dedicated Reflections Memory Care Neighborhood. You will assist residents in making the adjustment to a new concept of living at our luxury assisted living community, not only encouraging them to continue pursuing their interests, hobbies and lifestyle activities, but also to develop new and stimulating interests, as well. You will help plan fun and safe trips to suitable destinations, such as art galleries, theaters, music venues, racetracks, sports events as well as religious and cultural programs. You will also help prepare, print and distribute copies of our monthly calendar, newsletters and memos to residents. You will also be expected to perform planned activities in the absence of the Director of Recreation. In this role you will maintain a knowledge of resident backgrounds, hobbies, special interests, and spoken languages, etc., and use this knowledge to encourage resident engagement and participation. The loving attention you bring to the assistance you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Full Time, Part Time, and Per Diem schedules available


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* One year's prior experience working with a senior population, and those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia a plus
* At least 6 months of Recreation activity experience (art therapy, music therapy) or event leadership experience, and preferably in assisted living, long-term care or a similar industry setting
* Be outgoing, warm and have a genuine caring personality
* Able to create programs that get residents involved and excited
* Be dependable and able to supervise activities, special events and safe excursions for the residents
* Has creative talents in one or more areas, such as art, music, readings, dance, etc.
* Always maintaining oneself well-groomed and properly attired
* Demonstrates good listening and communication skills and always presents a positive spirit and professional attitude
* Possesses a proven ability to lead classes and other instructional learning sessions and speak in front of a group setting with ease, confidence and clarity
* Holds a high school diploma or equivalent at a minimum

**New Jersey locations: Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal accommodations**

title: Mobility Instructor (NY HELPS)
description:
**Minimum Qualifications**

Transfer: One year of permanent competitive or 55b/c service in this title.

Open to the Public: This title is part of the New York Hiring for Emergency Limited Placement Statewide Program (NY HELPS).\\* The minimum qualifications through the NY HELPS are:

A master's or bachelor's degree with specialization in orientation and mobility (Be sure to note the date of your degree on your application);  
Or  
A bachelor's degree and successful completion of the following courses:  
Anatomy of the Eye and Low Vision  
Psycho-Social Aspects of Visual Impairment  
Medical Aspects of Disability  
Methods in Orientation and Mobility  
Student Teaching in Orientation and Mobility\\*  
\\*One (1) year of actual experience in providing rehabilitation teaching of the blind may be substituted for this course in student teaching.

This position may be designated 55 b/c and is subject to verification of applicant eligibility.

**Duties Description**

Provide orientation and mobility training to blind persons, working with children, adult, and elderly clients in their homes and neighborhoods.  
Accept and screen referrals for mobility training from agencies and individuals. Develop and carry out individualized mobility training for each acceptable client.  
Coordinate services with other agencies, including transportation, occupational therapy, and counseling.  
Provide information about mobility procedures to clients, and follow up, after the completion of training, to determine whether further training or assistance is needed.  
Additional duties will be discussed in detail during the interview.

title: Quality Assurance Auditor - Administration
description:
Job description:

Reporting to the Director of Quality Assurance & Compliance, the Quality Assurance Auditor will be responsible for ensuring full record, health/safety, and physical plant compliance with all state and federal licensing/waiver requirements across all ArcMorris programming. S/he will create and maintain a program of unannounced audits and spot checks, based on previous audit reports and needs of the programs. The Quality Assurance Auditor works closely with the Quality Assurance Specialist to identify trends relating to incidents, and determines additional auditing needs based on findings. S/he takes an active role in being onsite during program annual inspections, and for accreditation renewals. The Quality Assurance Auditor assists in establishing methods to improve efficiency, reduce risks, address quality of services issues, and to reduce the vulnerability of fraud, abuse and waste.

Responsibilities

● Conducts quarterly compliance audits of all waiver programs, which includes, but is not limited to: individual files, clinical documentation, Individualized Service Plans (ISPs), Medical Administration Records (MAR), medical scripts, electronic health record documentation, agency policies, etc.; ● Ensures programs are in compliance with agency policies and procedures, as well as, licensing requirements set forth by both the Department of Children and Families (DCF), and the Department of Human Services (DHS), Division of Developmental Disabilities (DDD). ● Performs unannounced quality assurance checks of programs, citing staff shortages, life/safety and facility concerns, as well as speaking with staff about their knowledge of regulations, protocols, etc.; ● Communicates program performance and compliance through documented reporting procedures; ● Recommendations regarding administrative action and training as a result of audit findings; ● Monitors completion of corrective actions resulting audits, through spot checks, etc.; ● Elevate systemic issues and trends to the respective Residential Manager, Assistant Director, Director, and Chief Program Officer; ● Reports concerns or possible incidents to Quality Assurance Specialist, in accordance to the incident reporting levels and categories grid; ● Maintains and updates agency created program auditing tools; ● Aggregate quarterly audit trends and data; ● Use data/trends to drive agency KPIs and systemic areas for opportunity; ● Train internal and external agency stakeholders on quality assurance audit topics and trends; ● Provides necessary audit information and documents during annual licensing, accreditation, and state/federal audits; ● Other relevant and additional duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

Associates degree in Social Services, Psychology, Education or related field preferred, and three years of supervisory experience.

Minimum of three years working in the field of Developmental Disabilities.

Advanced computer skills, particularly with Microsoft Word, Excel and EHR systems; Strong problem solving, organization, and attention to detail;

Excellent verbal and written communication skills;

Must be able to use good judgment, actively listen and make sound decisions.

Must work autonomously with minimal supervision.

Must cooperate with the licensee, Department of Human Services (DHS) staff, Department of Children and Families (DCF) staff and any and all state representatives in any inspection or investigation.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Ability to Commute:

* Morris County, NJ (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Supply Yard Worker
description:
\\*\\*Overview\\*\\*

We are seeking a reliable and skilled Yard Worker to join our team. As a key member of our operations, you will be responsible for ensuring the efficient and safe movement of goods and equipment within our distribution center. This role requires a strong work ethic, attention to detail, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.

\\*\\*Duties\\*\\*

1. Operating Equipment: Safely maneuvering forklifts and wheel loaders to load and unload materials such as concrete bags, stone, pavers, blocks, and pipe etc.  
2. Loading and Unloading: Efficiently loading and unloading tractor trailers and various trucks with construction materials, ensuring proper handling and placement.  
3. Preparing Orders: Assembling and preparing orders based on customer requests, verifying quantities and types of materials.  
4. Customer Service: Assisting customers by accurately loading their orders and providing information about the materials, with the ability to communicate effectively in both Spanish and English.  
5. Inventory Management: Keeping track of inventory levels, ensuring materials are stored correctly, and notifying supervisors of stock shortages or issues.  
6. Safety Compliance: Adhering to safety protocols and regulations to prevent accidents and ensure a safe working environment.  
7. Maintenance: Performing routine maintenance checks on equipment and reporting any malfunctions or needed repairs.  
8. Coordination: Working closely with other yard staff to ensure smooth operations and timely fulfillment of orders.  
These duties require strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate clearly in both English and Spanish (Would be preferred).

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.67 - $19.69 per hour

Schedule:

* Day shift

* English (Required)

* Day Shift (Preferred)
